name: Richard Shelby
text: Today I joined @SenTuberville in introducing legislation to extend the authorization of the Muscle Shoals National Heritage Area for another 15 years. From the Tennessee River to Fame Recording Studio, the landmarks and historic culture of northwest Alabama should be preserved.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Afterschool professionals play a big role in the lives of millions of children each year. Thanks to quality programs & the individuals who staff them, parents can go to work while knowing their children are in a safe, positive learning environment. @AlabamaELA #HeartOfAfterSchool https://t.co/B4LDdwAUee

name: Richard Shelby
text: Saddened by the passing of a true statesman, Senator Orrin Hatch - the longest-serving senator in Utah history and former President Pro Tempore. Orrin cared deeply about his state and worked hard to advance meaningful legislation in the US Senate for 42 years. He will be missed.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Each Congress I introduce legislation that would result in an immediate tax cut for nearly all taxpayers and reduce the size, scope, and complexity of the IRS. #TaxDay serves as a reminder that our current tax code is not what this nation needs. https://t.co/AUirRsMaeG

name: Richard Shelby
text: My wife, Annette, and I wish everyone a happy Easter. He is risen. #EasterSunday https://t.co/KEwgORzN6a

name: Richard Shelby
text: Today I voted against the confirmation of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, the President's #SCOTUS nomination. My concerns regarding her judicial philosophy and sentencing record remain the same. As such, I do not believe she should serve on the Supreme Court. https://t.co/r6rDg1susU

name: Richard Shelby
text: .@UofAlabama received a competitive $360M @NOAA award to facilitate a cutting-edge Cooperative Institute focused on hydrology. This is excellent news for AL & its findings will influence decisions made across the continent for years to come. @AlabamaWater https://t.co/zpIe2ShbEQ

name: Richard Shelby
text: A lot of great things happening in several of Alabama’s downtowns. This article from @MadeinAL highlights some exciting projects and plans for growth for our Main Streets. @MainStreetAL https://t.co/7ASDNIteml

name: Richard Shelby
text: BIG news for Alabama! #ProjectKuiper will have a significant impact on our state through its investment in @ULAlaunch and others in the space industry. The agreement also aims to provide tens of millions of customers access to fast, affordable broadband. https://t.co/Tqlktgsfzc

name: Richard Shelby
text: While I enjoyed meeting Judge Jackson, her answers did not sufficiently alleviate my concerns. As such, I am unable to support her nomination to the Supreme Court. 3/3 https://t.co/r6rDg1susU

name: Richard Shelby
text: Judge Jackson and I had a candid discussion in which I questioned her about my concerns, such as her judicial philosophy, position on court-packing, and prior sentencing record as a judge. 2/3

name: Richard Shelby
text: Yesterday, I had the opportunity to meet with Judge Jackson. As with any #SCOTUS nominee, I believe it's important to carefully consider their qualifications & credentials, including their judicial philosophy, temperament, & prior decisions as a judge. 1/3 https://t.co/r6rDg1susU

name: Richard Shelby
text: This morning, I attended a Big 8 meeting with the Secretary of Defense. The FY23 budget he presented was utterly disconnected from reality. The American people should be concerned. With the challenges in the world, we don’t need to cut defense funding; we need a robust increase.

name: Richard Shelby
text: I want to thank @NEMA_DC for honoring me with their 2022 Legislative Award this afternoon. Throughout my time in Congress, I've been committed to advancing safety & security in the emergency management & homeland security community. A ready and informed nation is a strong nation. https://t.co/Pmt2MHk3Wq

name: Richard Shelby
text: President Biden, again, wants to overfund liberal policies and shortchange our military. His budget proposes a 14% increase for non-defense spending and only 4% for defense. We need to reverse those numbers. The security of the nation is paramount.

name: Richard Shelby
text: I am disappointed that the Administration chose not to build on Congress’s FY22 bipartisan work. Once again, this request puts us on the wrong foot to start the fiscal year 2023 cycle, and it does not bode well for the coming appropriations process. https://t.co/gbChmrd1l2

name: Richard Shelby
text: The Biden budget increases non-defense spending by nearly $100B while defense spending does not even keep pace with the skyrocketing rate of inflation. Also, as illegal border crossings occur at record rates, the President actually proposes a cut in spending for border security.

name: Richard Shelby
text: After his budget request last year was roundly rejected in Congress, the President has again proposed a fiscal blueprint that overspends on wasteful domestic programs & fails to adequately provide for our nation’s defense. In other words, more of the same. https://t.co/gbChmrd1l2

name: Richard Shelby
text: Pleased that @AuburnU was awarded a $24 million @DHSgov contract for canine detection research – the largest contract in the school’s history. This will further enhance their world-class, well-respected DCSITE program. Great news for Alabama & the nation. https://t.co/9hjKpkgdYL

name: Richard Shelby
text: I hope you will join me in celebrating #NationalAgDay and all that our farmers & producers do for our nation. They work tirelessly to keep this country fed and clothed, and I am proud to represent a state where #agriculture is a major driving economic force.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Today marks a significant milestone for @NASA_SLS, the most powerful rocket we've ever built! The SLS with the @NASA_Orion spacecraft will soon undergo final testing. This rocket is the result of a great deal of hard work. I commend everyone who helped make this possible. https://t.co/hRWSqiis3a

name: Richard Shelby
text: Wishing everyone a happy and lucky #StPatricksDay! https://t.co/10T0T23sFx

name: Richard Shelby
text: Zelenskyy’s address was a Churchillian moment. He spoke to Congress and the whole world about the plight of the Ukrainian people. We should do everything possible to help him, now.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Joined 48 of my @SenateGOP colleagues in urging @POTUS to focus on an Iran policy that seriously weakens their nuclear weapons capability, constrains Iran's ballistic missile program, and confronts Iran's support for terrorism. Now is not the time to be giving up leverage abroad. https://t.co/RS3NzhXHL3

name: Richard Shelby
text: I'm pleased to support Shalanda Young as the next OMB Director. Since February 2021, I have supported her for this position. A former Appropriations Cmte Staff Director, she knows the process inside-out and has demonstrated her ability to work with both sides to get the job done.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Growing the FBI’s presence in Huntsville has been a priority of mine for quite some time, and I am proud to have helped bring it to fruition with these FY22 funding bills. https://t.co/MOvSgo35Ik

name: Richard Shelby
text: I am very proud to announce that the FY22 funding bills include more than $1 billion for the Mobile area, with $300 million for improvements to the Port and the airport. This is great news for our Gulf Coast. https://t.co/cccBfpw9Tv

name: Richard Shelby
text: These FY22 funding bills invest in a host of domestic priorities, including medical research, agriculture, local infrastructure, & rural communities. These resources will bolster needed advancements, promote economic development, & encourage job creation. https://t.co/paOGdZxeEP

name: Richard Shelby
text: I am very pleased that the FY22 funding bills contain a significant increase of $42 billion to our defense budget to help develop, maintain, and equip our military forces and intelligence community. https://t.co/LNlOIxOJoR

name: Richard Shelby
text: On the non-defense side, it cuts billions of dollars in wasteful spending proposed in the President’s budget.  This is a good package, and I urge the President to sign it with haste. https://t.co/rQ0Oa7xGcP

name: Richard Shelby
text: This package bolsters our defense budget by $42 billion, with serious investments in modernization and readiness, and increases funding for border security. It also provides critical emergency assistance to our allies in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

name: Richard Shelby
text:
I am pleased to announce that Congress has now completed the FY22 appropriations process. I thank @SenatorLeahy, @rosadelauro, & @RepKayGranger, as well as @LeaderMcConnell & @SenSchumer for their diligence and determination to complete our work.
https://t.co/rQ0Oa7xGcP

name: Richard Shelby
text: My hope is that we can pass this legislation and use the same framework that made this bill possible as we begin the FY23 appropriations process.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Finally, the FY22 package provides critical emergency assistance to our military, Ukraine, and our European allies without reducing base defense spending by a single dollar.

name: Richard Shelby
text: The FY22 bill also provides an 11% increase over FY21 for the Department of Homeland Security and cuts nearly $65 billion in wasteful non-defense spending proposed in the Biden Administration’s budget – a nearly 10% decrease from the request level.

name: Richard Shelby
text: I urge my colleagues to support the FY22 Omnibus Appropriations bill. This bill provides $782 billion for the Department of Defense and for other defense functions – nearly $42 billion more than FY21.

name: Richard Shelby
text: As political compromise has become more and more difficult, great credit belongs to Appropriations Chairman @SenatorLeahy for making the tough choices that needed to be made to reach an agreement.

name: Richard Shelby
text: The FY22 appropriations package represents a massive bipartisan effort that rests upon a framework that preserves all legacy riders, rejects poison pill policy provisions from both sides, and achieves dollar-for-dollar funding parity for defense and non-defense increases.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Inflation is still rising and is now at 7.9% – breaking another 40 yr record. Gasoline and food were some of the highest contributors, with gasoline rising by 6.6%. We need leadership that is willing to do what it takes to get #inflation under control and protect price stability.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Good news! @Outdoor_Alabama has just announced the start date for 2022's #RedSnapper season. Beginning May 27, private & state-licensed charter vessel anglers can enjoy four-day weekends for fishing in state & federal waters. Looking forward to the season. https://t.co/vvfWClTGzn

name: Richard Shelby

name: Richard Shelby
text: I joined my @BankingGOP colleagues in urging the Biden administration to pause any financial regulatory efforts that threaten our energy independence. Americans have worked too hard for this administration to further saddle households with higher costs. https://t.co/RYZJ5eeNBk

name: Richard Shelby

name: Richard Shelby
text: Putin’s invasion of Ukraine comes as no surprise. He is on a mission to reconstitute the Soviet Union. This should be a wakeup call for the U.S. and our allies in Europe. Putin must be taken very seriously. A strong, unified response is imperative.

text: One year after the attack on the US Capitol, I remain grateful for @CapitolPolice & other brave law enforcement officers & National Guardsmen who protected us & defended our democracy. In all my years, I never thought that would happen in America. I hope it never happens again.

name: Richard Shelby
text: Sad to learn of the passing of my friend & former colleague from Georgia, Sen. Johnny Isakson. Johnny’s integrity, support for our veterans, & determination to find solutions will forever be part of his legacy. Annette & I send our condolences to his wife, Dianne, & their family.

name: Richard Shelby

Americans are rejecting the Democratic Party. They’re turning to the Republican Party because we will protect and restore the American Dream, for every American. 

We will govern with strength, pride, and honor, just as Reagan did.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
The American Dream has been secured by those, generation after generation, willing to endure the nightmare of war. We do not seek conflict, but we do not shrink from it either. 

So long as our enemies know this, we will keep the peace.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
Our troops fight for the flag on their shoulder and the buddies to their left and right. 

They don’t fight for abstractions like the “rules-based international order,” or “diversity,” or “climate change."

name: Tom Cotton
text: Putin wagered that if the American president wouldn’t stand up to a depraved gang of seventh-century savages in Afghanistan, there was no way he would stand up to Russia.

name: Tom Cotton
text: The Republican Party must always remain the party of work, protecting the opportunity to work, the dignity of work, and the value of work.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
For too long, our leaders have adopted short-term and short-sighted economic policies, selling off the inheritance of our ancestors for short-lived profit. 

We’ve been governed from quarter to quarter—as if America is a corporation, not a nation. This era must come to an end.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
Free trade isn’t free unless it flows both ways. 

China isn’t engaged in free trade, not even close.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
China’s entry into the WTO in 2001 began a hollowing out of America’s industrial base, economy, and working class. Many states, like mine, have lost a quarter of their manufacturing jobs. 

Factories closed, families splintered, and opportunities crumbled.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Both parties are complicit in one of the single worst mistakes of this generation: granting Communist China Permanent Most Favored Nation status and admitting it into the World Trade Organization.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
We must invest more in American workers, pay them more, and treat them better. 

The days of importing their replacements must come to an end.

name: Tom Cotton
text: The right amount of illegal immigration is zero.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
But the level of immigration—legal and illegal—has been too high for too long. And too many immigrants come here without needed skills or any means of support. 

They’re admitted instead by the random chance of geographic proximity or family connections.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Many immigrants are our greatest patriots, leaving behind impoverished, dangerous, and unfree countries for this land of hope. America takes great pride in them, their accomplishments, and their attachment to our shared nation.

name: Tom Cotton
text: We must reject the ideology of globalism, which claims that wide-open borders and wide-open markets are the path to prosperity for all. America’s shuttered factories, boarded-up main streets, and derelict drug dens stand as grim monuments that rebuke this theory.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
The phrase “America First” gives the vapors to globalists in both parties, partly because of its World War Two-era disrepute, but to the Jacksonian ear, it sounds like simple, obvious common sense. 

If we don’t put America first, who will?

name: Tom Cotton
text: That starts with a basic truth rejected by Democrats and, unfortunately, too many Republicans: we are a nation with an economy, not an economy with a nation. We are a people with principles, not a set of principles with a people.

name: Tom Cotton
text: We must rebuild an economy that works for all citizens, especially the forgotten men and women left behind by decades of open borders, unfettered trade, and globalization.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Our party should reverse this and once again put hardened, career criminals where they belong—back behind bars.

name: Tom Cotton
text: For four years, I led the fight against the First Step Act, when nearly everyone was on the other side, including former President Trump, in the worst mistake of his tenure.

name: Tom Cotton
text: No piece of legislation did more to harm Republicans' status as the party of public safety than the First Step Act.

name: Tom Cotton
text: They’ve contributed to the worst increase in murder rates on record and the most drug-overdose deaths ever. There’s only one answer to these radicals: Republicans must work to recall, remove, and replace every last Soros prosecutor.

name: Tom Cotton
text: In many Democratic-run cities, prosecutors refuse to prosecute. These “progressive” or “Soros prosecutors” haven’t just abused prosecutorial discretion, they’ve embraced prosecutorial nullification, ruling entire categories of serious crimes out of bounds for prosecution.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Here, too, Democrats have abandoned the American people—especially our most vulnerable citizens.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Along with protecting our liberty and preserving it for our posterity, our founders also understood that protecting our people from violence, crime, and the breakdown of law and order is another chief responsibility for the government.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Republicans are the party of opportunity, achievement, and excellence for all. We’ll keep schools open, involve parents as partners in their kid’s education, teach kids the skills they need, and restore patriotic education.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
Republicans must protect America’s kids from left-wing madness. 

As Reagan understood, a nation cannot long survive if its schoolchildren don’t learn basic skills but do learn to hate their country.

name: Tom Cotton
text: We shouldn’t be cowed by a dishonest media that conspires with the Democrats and Big Tech to cancel, censor, and smear normal Americans.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
The Democratic Party has abandoned the soul of Jacksonian Democracy, grounded in a deep and simple love of country, community, and American culture. 

They have cast aside those attributes embodied by the likes of Jackson and Washington: duty, honor, loyalty.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
For nearly two centuries, Democratic Party faithful celebrated President Jackson, seeing themselves as the party of the common man aligned against the forces of wealth and inherited power. 

Not anymore.

name: Tom Cotton
text: Ronald Reagan understood what every Republican officeholder must remember: we are elected first and foremost to protect the American people, their prosperity, and their freedom.

name: Tom Cotton
text:
Tonight, I'll be joining the Reagan Institute's Time for Choosing Speaker Series. 

You can watch my speech live here at 9 pm ET @Reagan_Library:

https://t.co/T3clTeLQhR

The choice between Russian energy and American energy shouldn’t be difficult. My bill would end support for Russia and lower the cost of gas.

name: Tom Cotton

Any emergency spending bill for Ukraine must include lethal assistance. President Zelensky has called for ammo. We should send him ammo.

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: At least 100 bullets were fired in rapid succession during the Sacramento mass shooting on April 3. The weapons used were able to fire at such high rates because of a part — commonly known as a glock switch — that allows semi-automatic handguns to fire at fully automatic rates.

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: The Supreme Court should look like the country it serves, and with this confirmation, we move closer to that ideal. I’m proud to support Judge Jackson’s historic confirmation and I’m glad to see the Senate confirm her with bipartisan support. https://t.co/zUax4OhofZ

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text:
The Senate vote to confirm Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson as Supreme Court Justice Jackson will take place soon. 

She is extremely qualified, an extraordinary person and of impeccable character. 

It’s my great pleasure to vote to confirm her.

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: The lack of affordable housing is driving the homelessness crisis in California and nationwide. @SenAlexPadilla and I are calling on congressional leadership to ensure significant investments in affordable housing are included in any future spending package. https://t.co/BWtsHGEC04

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: Gas prices on the West Coast are outrageous and far higher than most other states. That’s why I joined @SenatorCantwell and @RonWyden to demand an FTC investigation into whether these high gas prices are the result of market manipulation. https://t.co/I1XyqvqXFN

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: It will be my great pleasure to vote to confirm Judge Jackson to be an associate justice on the Supreme Court. And I hope that my colleagues on both sides of the aisle will do the same.

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: What has impressed me most about Judge Jackson does not appear on her resume. That is Judge Jackson’s steadfast commitment to the fair and impartial application of the law, her deep knowledge of the U.S. Constitution and her remarkable judicial temperament.

name: Senator Dianne Feinstein
text: I have carefully scrutinized Judge Jackson’s record and listened very closely to her testimony. In my view, Judge Jackson is both well qualified and extremely prepared to take on the important role of serving on the United States Supreme Court.

text:
I'm heading to the Senate floor to call for an extension of the expanded #ChildTaxCredit and remind families to claim their enhanced benefits ahead of Tax Day.

We must extend the CTC to send families immediate relief as costs continue to rise.

Tune in: https://t.co/cmXncQlprz

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Today, I'm joining @POTUS at the White House as he strengthens the #ACA and fixes the family glitch to expand coverage — something I proposed with @timkaine.

Let’s continue to build on the ACA to increase access and lower health care costs for families.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Good news for Coloradans on Medicare: You can now get up to 8 free COVID-19 tests per month from your pharmacy or doctor’s office.

More information is available here ➡️
https://t.co/tCzDNvTyAw

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Sickened and outraged by the images from Bucha and areas surrounding Kyiv. America and the world cannot ignore allegations of war crimes. We must hold Putin accountable for his vile attacks on humanity.

Putin imagines himself above the law. He is not.

name: Michael Bennet
text: Good. Now let's make sure that if we liquidate it, any funds go to the Ukrainian people like @SenRobPortman and I proposed in our RELIEF for Ukraine Act.  https://t.co/DseVplTJ1O

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Most Americans can file for FREE through the IRS. 

Learn more or file your return today: https://t.co/6o9W6kSkMs 

Also, your family may qualify for filing assistance. Visit https://t.co/L0hOqW4qtf for more information.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Reminder: Tax Day is April 18 — just two weeks away.

You may be eligible to claim the Child Tax Credit, Earned Income Tax Credit, and Child and Dependent Care Credit, which were all expanded through the #AmericanRescuePlan.

More info:
https://t.co/MmrLhCv05g

name: Michael Bennet
text:
As we continue to return to normal, more U.S. citizens are seeking to travel outside of the country. 

If you're having trouble navigating the passport renewal or application process, we can help. 

Call our office at 303-455-7600 or visit our website: https://t.co/UvnwQS6FPD

name: Michael Bennet
text:
🚨Bipartisan Infrastructure Law News🚨

Colorado will receive over $50M to help families make their homes more energy efficient and more resilient to climate change. 

This will help lower energy costs, create good-paying jobs in our communities, and protect public health.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
TEACHERS: On your 2022 tax return, the educator expense deduction will increase to $300 to help cover the cost of this year’s classroom supplies. More: https://t.co/JMZLJITVas 

I'll keep working with @SenatorCollins to expand this benefit to include early childhood educators.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
We passed legislation to hold shipping companies accountable as they continue to exploit supply chain issues to drive up prices. 
 
We're one step closer to stopping these unfair price hikes to lower costs for Colorado businesses, including agricultural exporters, and consumers.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
We cannot accept any Colorado community living by a polluted river.

This project will take an important step to lift hundreds of families out of a floodplain, create opportunity, and make Colorado's beautiful outdoors more accessible to all. https://t.co/ghsHQdl8n3

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Today, I joined @MayorHancock and @SenatorHick to celebrate $350M to restore the South Platte River from the bipartisan infrastructure law.

This historic investment has been years in the making, and I'm incredibly grateful for the local collaboration that made this possible. https://t.co/NcrlJuDtmL

name: Michael Bennet
text:
As the Ukrainian people suffer the daily nightmare of Putin's invasion, they will need our support for many years to come.

My bill with @SenRobPortman directs funds from the seized assets of Putin and his oligarchs to support Ukrainian refugees, reconstruction, and recovery. https://t.co/GBd7M2XKQg

name: Michael Bennet
text: I'll be there in the front row. With my cowbell. https://t.co/k6XbXw9yMC

name: Michael Bennet
text: I'm glad @POTUS is releasing oil to help lower costs at the pump, and encouraged to see intent to replenish the SPR. This can help with market volatility, and I hope to see further action to help us achieve energy security and a resilient transition to a clean-energy economy.

name: Michael Bennet
text: We wrote this bill with Coloradans to help more students succeed — especially students of color, students with disabilities, and students from disadvantaged families who are disproportionately affected by overly harsh punitive policies, like “zero-tolerance.”

name: Michael Bennet
text: NEWS: @RepCohen and I introduced a bill to help schools build safe, inclusive learning environments and to encourage the use of restorative practices instead of harsh discipline policies, which push kids out of schools and into the criminal justice system. https://t.co/jvlGXHNgme

name: Michael Bennet
text:
This #TransDayOfVisibility, we celebrate the contributions, successes, and resilience of trans people as we work to end the discrimination and violence they face every day. 
 
The Senate must act and pass the #EqualityAct to take much-needed steps to protect trans people. https://t.co/rymUZ1xuY0

name: Michael Bennet
text:
César Chávez was a fierce advocate for farmworkers' rights. He fought for better working conditions and fair wages his whole life.

To carry on his legacy, we must support America's workers and continue his fight for social and economic justice. #CesarChavezDay https://t.co/UMpqbP3d0C

name: Michael Bennet
text:
BIG NEWS: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law invests $350M to restore ecosystems and protect neighborhoods and businesses along the South Platte River from flooding. 

After years of work, I’m glad we’re going to get this done for Colorado families and communities. https://t.co/YiO41tUo4g

name: Michael Bennet
text: Today, I intro'd legislation with @SenatorBennet to require @thejusticedept to direct funds resulting from the disposal of seized Russian assets, through their Task Force KleptoCapture, into a new Ukraine Relief Fund to support Ukrainian refugees & the reconstruction of Ukraine.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
The #NCARFire marks the end of the shortest season Colorado has had without a significant wildfire — just three months.

As climate change fuels increasingly frequent disasters, Coloradans expect us to address this crisis.

Congress must act to protect our communities.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
On #NationalVietnamWarVeteransDay, we honor the millions of brave Americans who served during one of our nation's longest wars.

We are forever in their debt, and must ensure that veterans across Colorado and the U.S. have access to the health care and resources that they earned.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Putin and his inner circle bear direct responsibility for the war in Ukraine and the death, destruction, and dislocation it has unleashed.

My bill with @SenRobPortman requires that funds from oligarchs' seized assets go directly to the Ukrainian people. https://t.co/bJTiStgnFQ

name: Michael Bennet
text:
We must keep holding Putin accountable for his war on Ukraine — that includes revoking permanent normal trade relations with Russia to isolate it further from the global economy.

We cannot afford Republican efforts to obstruct this bill. The Senate should pass it without delay.

name: Michael Bennet
text:
I'm glad everyone is safe and that the evacuation orders have been lifted for the #NCARFire.

Thank you to our first responders who fight to protect our communities every day. 

Continue to follow @BoulderOEM for updates. https://t.co/4n6M0qq2HM

name: Michael Bennet
text:
Cathay Williams was born enslaved. She became the only known woman to serve with the Buffalo Soldiers — an all-Black Army regiment — after posing as a man to enlist. Following her honorable discharge, she settled in Colorado.

I'm deeply grateful for Cathay's service.

📸:@USArmy https://t.co/AIf9XVAhXu

name: Michael Bennet
text:

name: Michael Bennet
text:

name: Michael Bennet

#BoulderStrong

Tralona Bartkowiak

name: Chris Murphy
text:
For those who downplay the role of guns in mass shootings and say just focus on policing: the cops see it differently.

Shootings are often over in seconds, before police arrive.

The Sacramento mass shooting occurred near one of the most heavily protected sites in California. https://t.co/fuptlO8WuY

name: Chris Murphy
text: April 7 will be known as “Sen DURBIN saved baseball day” That’s start of season.  He threatened ending MLB antitrust exemption

name: Chris Murphy
text: Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited Bucha today. His face says it all. https://t.co/IWOmIdnnVT

name: Chris Murphy
text: SC came out on fire and without Fudd and Westbrook at 💯 it just wasn’t going to be our night. But what a run. What guts. Can’t wait to see this team back next year. https://t.co/x7eCo2wO8t

name: Chris Murphy
text: Excited for tonight. I’m telling myself South Carolina is the better team and it’s really hard for a championship team to be led by a freshman and sophomore…but I really really want to win. Let’s go!! https://t.co/AutY0UGMvv

name: Chris Murphy
text: Be careful before watching this. The war crimes that Russia has committed are beyond description. Those that committed and authorized these acts will be damned by history and must be held accountable now. https://t.co/ZWdtN6yhG6

name: Chris Murphy
text:
Pretty good point here from @ChrisMurphyCT 

https://t.co/MGroulvstr https://t.co/sTiNVVWdhJ

name: Chris Murphy
text: .@ChrisMurphyCT: "The spouse of a Supreme Court justice was involved in an effort to organize a coup and overthrow a democratically-elected president [...] The fact there is no clear, binding code of conduct that addresses this [...] is just unacceptable. https://t.co/cwuNqbimx2 https://t.co/WB05e3btU4

name: Chris Murphy
text:
So what’s an “LGBT agenda”? 

Respecting people for who they are? Not being awful toward people just based on who they love?

That’s a pretty innocuous “agenda”. 

The hate and prejudice industry in this nation is so sad and scary. https://t.co/93hdhC81ql

name: Chris Murphy
text: Congress can shape a safer, more inspiring future by supporting President Biden’s effort to reenter a good Iran Nuclear Deal. I'm live on the Senate floor.  https://t.co/DDiBjbADqs

name: Chris Murphy
text: “It’s important to remember that not one Democratic lawmaker who voted for the Iran deal in 2015 lost their seat to someone who opposed the deal in 2016. Not one." -@dylanotes  https://t.co/A3Mqg8QFQE

name: Chris Murphy
text:
It’s just so disturbing that many political leaders see trans people as targets to bully and harass. 

In Connecticut, we have your back. We see you. We celebrate you. #TransRightsAreHumanRights #TransDayOfVisbility https://t.co/IevD8AF0eG

name: Chris Murphy
text: More evidence of how broken the Senate is. Totally non-controversial nominees to important but relatively obscure agencies are now regularly blocked by Republicans. https://t.co/tAc11HQ6pU

name: Chris Murphy
text: FYI the NCAA opposed NIL for decades. https://t.co/pHUsfFLM9k

name: Chris Murphy
text: Sen. @ChrisMurphyCT: "As someone who's a diehard college sports fan, I want students to have the ability to go to school and play sports, but get fairly compensated for the amount of money that they're making right now for everybody else in the college sports industry.”

name: Chris Murphy
text:
I’m on the way to the Senate floor to talk about my Supreme Court Ethics Act and the need for the Supreme Court to adopt a binding Code of Conduct. 

The Thomas revelations make it clear - the Supreme Court cannot and should not police itself.

name: Chris Murphy
text:
Think back to the days before the invasion, when the conventional wisdom was a Russian victory and occupation of Kiev within days. 

Then read this tweet and look at this map. https://t.co/rC6t5Ii9zt

name: Chris Murphy
text: Really good news. Now the Saudis and the Houthis need to seize this opportunity and begin a political process. There is zero evidence that continued bloodshed strengthens the hand of either side.  https://t.co/lrwEmPq8tc

name: Chris Murphy
text: Very exciting!! https://t.co/sVYgbxVAn6

name: Chris Murphy
text: LIVE: Tune in to watch a discussion with current and former athletes and advocates about the gross inequities within the college sports system, and what we can do to fix them @ChrisMurphyCT https://t.co/bLGC66ulKg

name: Chris Murphy
text: Madness, Inc. is here. Tune in to watch our discussion with current and former athletes and advocates about the gross inequities within the college sports system, and what we can do to fix them. https://t.co/ioea36Xpx4

name: Chris Murphy
text:
There’s something wrong with a system that generates billions for the rich but doesn't share a dime with the athletes doing the work. 

Tune in at 12:15 for a Twitter live conversation on the inequities within the college sports system, and how we can fix them. https://t.co/rd8W06Dqpt

name: Chris Murphy
text:
The 9 Supreme Court justices are the only federal judges who aren't subject to a code of conduct. That's ridiculous.

My Supreme Court Ethics Act fixes this, and support for the bill is growing by the day. https://t.co/93bUO2q0hO

name: Chris Murphy
text: I will be on @maddow at 9:15 to talk about the latest developments in Ukraine. @MSNBC

name: Chris Murphy
text: So many of them talk a tough game on Ukraine but then over and over, run a coordinated sabotage game. https://t.co/HXSONUUrAh

name: Chris Murphy
text: And FYI Republicans have no objection to the actual nominee. He’s a career civil servant who is non-controversial and unquestionably qualified. They are objecting just to make life as miserable as possible for Biden.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: @SafeRoadsNow thanks @JanSchakowsky & @SenBlumenthal for participating in today’s press conference and for their efforts to make hot car deaths a thing of the past through safety technology requirements. https://t.co/gtPaEk2kcU

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
ICYMI: Last night Senate Republicans tried to undermine #TitleX & deny access to health care, like cancer screening, birth control, & STI testing/treatment.

I joined Senate Dems in blocking this attack, but we know they won’t stop coming. It's critical we continue to #ProtectX.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: President Biden's $33 billion Ukraine aid request is another step—by no means the last—in keeping faith & fulfilling our commitments. Congress must put its money where its mouth is—matching rhetoric with real action.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Today on #YomHaShoah we join together to honor the memory of the 6 million Jews murdered by the Nazis. We must stand fast to our promise of #NeverAgain & fight back against anti-Semitism & hate in all its many forms.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: THURSDAY at 11am ET: @SafeRoadsNow, @KidsandCars, @janschakowsky, @SenBlumenthal & families affected by hot car deaths & injuries will call on @USDOT to quickly advance the child protection “hot cars” mandate in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. https://t.co/hDma06FrMY

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
McKinsey got away with playing the system—helping fuel the opioid epidemic for far too long. The FDA should have taken this obvious step years ago.

It’s critical OIG investigate these clear conflicts of interest to understand why existing FDA rules were ignored. https://t.co/rPmUtvhXj5

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Vanessa Avery is fair & tough & will follow the facts & law to deter & punish wrongdoers. CT is lucky to have her leadership & I am proud to have recommended her nomination to the White House with Senator @ChrisMurphyCT.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Vanessa Avery is a proven prosecutor, a thoughtful leader, & a champion for CT’s people. She is a dedicated & diligent public servant with broad experiences across the legal profession that will no doubt inform & inspire her work as U.S. Attorney. https://t.co/hdHyCIxnWn

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: (1/2) This morning, workers at the Graduate Hotel New Haven announced their campaign to win a union - for fair schedules, fair wages, and RESPECT. RT to show support and urge Graduate Hotels to follow the law and allow workers to go through the process without intimidation. https://t.co/4WeHPhyhTg

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Congrats to @UConn students on winning the Campus RainWorks Challenge. As the next generation of environmental professionals, you are bringing innovative, compelling solutions to the forefront of green infrastructure design. https://t.co/eG3qGLzbZ1

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: As a member of the Judiciary Committee, I look forward to championing Judge Merriam’s nomination, which I expect to receive the same bipartisan support as did her confirmation to the U.S. District Court.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Her values emphasize equity, & equal opportunity. Judge Merriam’s a great listener—taking seriously every legal claim, & following the facts & law with care & intellect.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Judge Merriam has demonstrated deep legal insight, unflinching fairness, & fidelity to justice. She will bring to the appellate court an unstinting commitment to the rule of law at a time when its importance is paramount. https://t.co/k6KESvv9Qe

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Russian oligarchs are Putin’s partners in conflict—profiting off his cruel war. Glad to see AG Garland agrees that we should seize their assets & use these funds to assist Ukrainian freedom fighters. Let's pass the Asset Seizure for Ukraine Reconstruction Act. https://t.co/5XOoy4zcEA

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: @ChrisMurphyCT Wishing you a swift recovery. Feel better soon!

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Thankfully, America is sending Ukraine weapons like Howitzers, M113 Armored Personnel Carriers, Javelins & Stingers from our own supplies. Our cupboards will be bare—endangering our security—without the DPA. Manufacturers need a clear demand signal.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: U.S. has given 1/3 of our Javelin missiles to Ukraine—with many more needed. At current pace— unacceptably—a year is necessary to produce 1,000.  Proof that we need the Defense Production Act.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Our latest surge of weapons to Ukraine marks a major challenge to manufacturers. America is rapidly depleting its inventories of key arms—needing urgent restocking. Utilize the Defense Production Act.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: The soaring rate of gun violence is as inexcusable as it is heartbreaking. Our kids are dying—their lives senselessly stolen. These deaths are preventable if we take action w/Ethan’s Law, universal background checks, community violence intervention & more.https://t.co/OPJQXrbvZo

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
Tinnitus is the most commonly diagnosed service-connected disability&yet the VA is considering changing the rules to make it more difficult for vets to receive related benefits&treatment. 

Unacceptable—which is why @SenatorTester & I are urging the VA to drop this proposal. https://t.co/G48limFFQb

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: President Biden is making a smart choice. Ambassador Brink is a supremely skilled diplomat with years of experience that make her well qualified to lead @USEmbassyKyiv. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to move swiftly to confirm this critical nomination.https://t.co/wgzm0JrkBF

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A richly deserved recognition for this extraordinary leader & man of faith—a scholar, musician, inventor, husband, father, & grandfather—who has given his life to service.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: I was honored to join the community at Calvary Temple Christian Center yesterday as Bishop John Thompson was awarded the Presidential Citation for Lifetime Achievement. https://t.co/poInojQop7

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A joyous, sunlit celebration of 50 years—softball, fun, & family—at Beardsley Park yesterday. The Coed Softball League started another season with high spirit & energy, & lots of camaraderie. https://t.co/eoOwFWmnXu

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Gold Star Families now have a beautiful&meaningful memorial in Berlin’s Veterans Park. A dedication ceremony brought together families, leaders, like Helen Keiser-Pedersen,&Woody Williams Foundation in music, emotion&eloquent remarks. We must never forget their service&sacrifice. https://t.co/krOeIVSAQv

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Wonderful MLK brunch in Meriden yesterday—a great turnout to recognize very special young people & highlight keynote address from @SecCardona. Rescheduled from January, it had all the same spirit & energy. Thanks Rhudean Raye! https://t.co/XjeKGGlcl7

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Heartfelt wishes to all who are celebrating Orthodox Easter. May today be filled with joy, reflection, & happiness.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Hundreds marched in Fairfield yesterday—a Walk In Her Shoes—to stand with survivors & law enforcement against domestic violence in powerful, eloquent solidarity. We must break this vicious, insidious cycle of abuse. Thanks to the Center for Family Justice & Deb Greenwood! https://t.co/m7EZe6pHDM

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: To provide transparency & tools, our Kids Online Safety Act is an imperative step, a bare minimum, for Congress to pass. Parents & kids need the means to take control over ads & algorithms driving destructive content. Beating back Big Tech’s lobbyists is tough, but doable.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Americans also need & deserve protections from the excesses & abuses of Big Tech. We must fight for them urgently—especially safeguarding kids—in the time remaining this session. As I’ve said repeatedly, enforcement resources are key, in the US & worldwide.https://t.co/blnvspVWU8

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: These young women, survivors of Larry Nassar’s horrific abuse, deserve not just apologies, but action. That’s why I’ve demanded accountability of the FBI agents who failed to take steps to stop Nassar, & why the survivors are seeking their own remedies. https://t.co/qgt2nw4yJo

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: I would have loved to spend all day at the beach at Esker Point—especially to announce $725,000 in federal funds for an extraordinary coastal resilience project. It will reduce flooding, restore habitat, forestall erosion, enhance hiking, & more. Glad we fought for it. https://t.co/itY68jOSBc

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Wonderful visit to Fort Hill Farm, with owners Kies & Jared Orr-LaVack, celebrating it becoming the 400th farm to join the Farm Preservation Program. They’ve just installed an anaerobic digester using USDA funding to generate power from manure & food waste. Happy Earth Day! https://t.co/a6LUzlah3W

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A sparkling sunlit spring Earth Day at West Thompson Lake, where we celebrated opening the new Blain Rd Footbridge—built with federal money we fought hard for—making accessible miles of trails & countless special times in this truly pristine place. https://t.co/QYxEWXki8I

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Inspiring Earth Day celebration at Ash Creek sand spit, where local environmental activists are saving a critical habitat & shoreline treasure from erosion. Thanks to communities of Bridgeport & Fairfield for your solid stewardship. https://t.co/DHNgGgSx7i

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: L’Ambiance Plaza ceremony was a moving tribute to the 28 men who needlessly perished 35 years ago because perilous, problematic lift slab construction was not yet banned. To honor them, let’s make workers’ safety a priority & thank organized labor for leading the fight. https://t.co/zknEEhIlxB

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Happy #EarthDay! Today we celebrate our planet’s amazing beauty, but also redouble our efforts to confront climate change’s real, immediate threat. Urgent action is needed to preserve & protect our planet for generations to come. https://t.co/X819ZdE1qk

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Military support announced today is a positive step—it needs to be followed by more—to give Ukraine a fair fight against Putin’s barbaric war machine. As I’ve urged repeatedly, much more must be provided in air defense, planes, missiles, & the like. https://t.co/CjvHAASkEc

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Replacing the Walk Bridge & 3 others in Norwalk is vital to rail travel on the entire Northeast Corridor—which is why we fought so hard for $15M to help get it done. Bridges built in the 1890’s cannot provide the safety & speed, reliability & resilience, that riders deserve. https://t.co/ixGEvVhmTz

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Thrilled that @CTFoodshare is teaming up with @USDA’s Local Food Purchase Program to combat food insecurity. This innovative program will create new markets for local farmers & more opportunities for people in need. https://t.co/pBkvxipDEP

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Exciting to see the final phase of construction begin on the Honey Locust Square development in Bridgeport’s East End & sign one of the building support beams. This new grocery story & retail plaza will help drive economic growth & expand local shopping options. https://t.co/pUzS4vsVxj

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: This funding is just the first step. Construction on a new services center will be a game changer, offering job trainings & paid work experiences. By building community partnerships, Youth Continuum is changing the trajectory of these young people’s lives.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Excited to announce $500,000 in federal funding for New Haven’s Youth Continuum & their work to support vulnerable youth. This vital grant will change countless lives—addressing homelessness, trafficking, substance abuse, mental health, & other challenges. https://t.co/zT60n3ivE6

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Waterford's library has warm, welcoming, hardworking staff spearheading new exhibits on women’s suffrage & key historic decisions. I was excited to visit with First Selectman @brule_rob & announce more federal grant support. A magnificent community resource! https://t.co/NmyoZf06O0

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Very exciting & important improvements at Butter Brook Hill Apartments in New Milford with $1.7 million in federal grants that we fought for. Visiting with @RepJahanaHayes, I saw the clear need for renovations to make the 102 units more accessible for seniors living there. https://t.co/kvR7QFHnDt

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Having a hot meal can transform someone’s day. I truly admire the New American Dream Foundation for their incredible work providing housebound seniors with fantastic food. @RepJahanaHayes & I are privileged to announce $50,000 in federal funding to support this critical program. https://t.co/nJAVKDvyE8

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: The last time I met Alwyn was at a naturalization ceremony a few years ago, when I congratulated him on becoming an American citizen. In the years since, it’s been incredible to watch him succeed & see how much he has contributed to our state. https://t.co/XH5pHDmOkA

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Restored to brilliant luster, New London’s Lighthouse Inn is an iconic gem, about to reopen thanks to commitment & caring work by owner Alwyn Christy. I was excited to visit with @NLMayorMikeP, whose enthusiastic support along with the city’s has made a big difference. https://t.co/X8BwXauG8f

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A moving rededication in New London of the John J. McGuirk VA Community-Based Outpatient Clinic, providing vets with expanded space & services for health care—much needed & well deserved. Vets merit world class quality medicine close to their homes—as this facility should afford. https://t.co/cUQmeQ5Uz6

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Forensic science—collecting, preserving & analyzing complex evidence—is critical to effective prosecution & public safety. I fought for this significant grant to provide such expertise, after listening to police & knowing its importance from my own law enforcement experience.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: I’m proud to support CT police & law enforcement with state of the art forensic science training & skills through a $120,000 federal grant to UNH’s @LeeForensicInst. Policing is a profession, deserving advanced know how. https://t.co/bi87p8YW9L

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Imposing additional pressure on families already stretched for housing, food, medicine, & other essential costs, utilities’ heartless debt collection should have been halted. Consumers deserve better—such actions must be stopped now & during future emergencies.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Even as the pandemic spread & unemployment skyrocketed, documents show Eversource & Avangrid continued debt collections against already struggling families. Today I joined @ClaireColemanCT in a letter urging these utilities to do the right thing—stop ongoing debt collections. https://t.co/ref8cAZL8o

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Happy #Easter to all. Sending many blessings & best wishes to you during this celebration of hope & renewal.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: MarkZero Prototypes in Watertown—a rapidly growing, innovative small business—is conducting groundbreaking work, using natural energy of the ocean to produce clean, safe drinking water. Prize winners in a national competition, they’re making CT proud. https://t.co/fdQxksUtwb

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: From my family to yours, #ChagSameach! I hope this #Passover is a time of reflection, peace, & happiness for you & your loved ones.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: New Haven’s @AtticusCafe is a star of community spirit & job creation. Named Family-Owned Small Business of the Year by @SBA_Connecticut, its East Rock & Chapel Street locations are a great stop for a book & a bite to eat. https://t.co/HXYrLp33EE

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: First responders, especially police & fire services, need & deserve this support. Newington earned it!

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Newington’s new Emergency Operations Center—to be built with $1 million in federal funds we fought for—will enable the town to better address weather & public safety challenges, & coordinate with state emergency operations. https://t.co/TWwxpgdcoX

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Champion athletes of Wilbur Cross High School, inducted into its Hall of Fame yesterday, join impressive ranks of great achievers. I was proud to join friends & family in cheers & support at this wonderful event.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
Westport’s Saugatuck River will be dredged—for the first time in 50 yrs—thanks to our CT delegation championing $2.8 million in federal funds & town leadership from Jim Marpe & Jennifer Tooker. It’s a win-win for boaters & economic & environmental values.

https://t.co/pLbqS4RIhI

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Liberation Programs will use $150,000 in federal funds—which we fought for—to add Family Recovery Coaches to its great staff. Peer & family support are vital to treating substance abuse & long term recovery. Thank you for caring so deeply. https://t.co/wMXFc73Uvb

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Fairfield’s new communications system—using federal funds we secured—will cover gaps & connect all emergency responders, supporting police & fire service. This grant will bring it into the 21st century. https://t.co/oW88XKllmZ

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Urgent action is needed. It’s time for Congress to pass my & @MarshaBlackburn’s bipartisan Kids Online Safety Act.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
Appalling & outrageous—children as young as 9 y/o trapped in bubbles of eating disorder content on Instagram. 

Despite promises to parents, Facebook & its Big Tech peers have failed kids & are unwilling to clean up their act.
 
https://t.co/4U4xyJIwt1

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Warm #Vaisakhi greetings to all who are celebrating. May this wonderful, festive occasion be filled with joy, abundance, & high spirts.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Invoking the Defense Production Act is an urgently vital step to meet Ukraine’s need for military aid as our & allies’ arms stocks are depleted. The industry must be mandated to make missiles, artillery, drones, air defense batteries, helicopters & more at lowest reasonable cost. https://t.co/hd0hNd2KYK

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Businesses like LTI moving & expanding in Hartford is a vote of confidence in our city & state. Proud to support this exciting growth as local businesses succeed & make plans for the future. https://t.co/FQAIgtoBPn

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Proud to join Mayor Stewart in New Britain to celebrate the Borinqueneers—Puerto Rican patriots, honored with a Congressional Gold Medal that I championed in 2014. These brave, fierce veterans fought for our nation & richly deserved this recognition. https://t.co/KoRVI8QQRF

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Middletown’s Oddfellows Playhouse—a magnificent program of youth performance & culture—is receiving $48,000 in federal funding that we helped secure for a new van. Transportation is vital for the kids to reach the theater & return to their homes. It will have a big impact. https://t.co/F0W1eJf9zq

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Marie Melisi’s secret to 109 years: healthy living & being kind to everybody she meets. “Everyone’s different, but everyone’s loved.”

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Celebrating Marie Melisi’s birthday—109 years young! Family, friends, Milford Mayor Ben Blake, & I enjoyed this magnificent spring day with Marie & the great staff of the West River Healthcare Center. https://t.co/hW0RYeKNuf

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: The CT delegation is bringing home millions of dollars in transformative transportation funding. We will be investing in projects to repair & modernize our aging infrastructure while creating jobs, reducing pollution, & making our transit systems work better for the people of CT. https://t.co/NmzNXOD5AO

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Republicans & Democrats agree, Steve Dettelbach is a phenomenal candidate to lead ATF. He has a proven track record as a dedicated career prosecutor who understands the devastating reality of gun violence & will take meaningful action to stop its harms. https://t.co/esEqz4a6if

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: I am also proud to work with the Carpenters Union to combat worker exploitation by construction companies who misclassify employees as independent contractors, fail to pay fair wages, & refuse to provide workers compensation for injuries on the job.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Carpenters Local 326 is preparing the next generation for the jobs of the present & future. Federal infrastructure funding will help create more opportunities in this high-quality, well-paid profession. https://t.co/0bC2aToIVT

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A classic, catastrophic conflict of interest—helping Purdue duck safety regulation while profiting from advice to FDA safety regulators. No disclosure, no public protection, no shame. No whitewashing or wishing it away. Time for DOJ to investigate. https://t.co/DDdi5Hmpae

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Delighted to be at United Sewing & Design to recognize & congratulate Mary Ruth Shields on being named SBA CT Manufacturer of the Year. It is clear her & her team put incredible care, craftsmanship, & creativity into each & every one of their products & prototypes. https://t.co/v2JbcvKQw2

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: SBA New England had the chance to meet with Stony Creek Brewery and @SenBlumenthal yesterday. CT #smallbusinesses are making a comeback with help from SBA's COVID relief programs. https://t.co/ochACCkHIY via @nhregister

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Russian atrocities in Bucha, Mariupol, & other parts of Ukraine, are designed to terrorize civilians. The full force of US & international law must be brought to bear. Investigate Putin as a war criminal & Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism. 4

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Despite two additional Russian banks being added to the sanctions list, a majority of Russian banks are still operating as if everything is “business as usual.” In reality they are being used to fund Russian war crimes. We must do more to enforce strict, significant sanctions. 3/

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: We must continue immediate assistance—ammunition, Javelins, Stingers & air defense—but also prepare Ukraine for the long-term with training on advanced western systems, like PATRIOT, & provide A-10s & howitzers we want to divest or retire. 2/

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: As Putin’s horrendous war crimes in Ukraine are exposed—from the bloodbath in Bucha to the massacre in Mariupol—we must continue strengthening the Ukrainian military, providing humanitarian aid&bring Putin to justice. Putin has time on his side but we can change that calculus. 1/ https://t.co/jKjzFnGAjV

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: The Swift Factory is a juggernaut of economic opportunity & expansion in Hartford’s North End. Fantastic to join @RepJohnLarson, @MayorBronin, & community leaders to announce $3.7 million in federal investment to support small businesses & promote workforce training. https://t.co/7ZwAygUE5b

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: This resolution is a tribute to the heroic actions of our nation’s veterans & civilian volunteers whose relentless work saved the lives of countless Afghan allies. https://t.co/fjHu9eT96N

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: For 2 decades, Afghan translators, interpreters, & guards for the U.S. mission provided our soldiers & diplomats w/invaluable support. As they sought refuge from assured torture & death by the Taliban, Americans back home stepped up to protect the allies that once protected them.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Congratulations Viron Rondo Osteria on being named 2022 CT SBA State Small Business Person. Over the past two years Viron & his restaurant adapted & persisted through unprecedented times. His entrepreneurship & ingenuity are truly inspiring. https://t.co/yn5eGxXR68

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: ATF desperately needs dynamic leadership—a Senate confirmed chief executive with a mandate for vigorous enforcement & vital accountability. I look forward to swift Senate action on this long overdue nomination.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Steve Dettelbach is an excellent choice to lead ATF. In two decades serving with law enforcement on the front lines of the gun epidemic, he learned firsthand what works to prevent more gun deaths & protect against violent crime. https://t.co/1rCRct9OFk

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: This measure helps support police efforts to combat crimes by tracing the weapons used to commit them. New technology makes ghost guns one of the biggest emerging threats.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: The rule finalized today will allow law enforcement to finally take action to stop anyone exploiting a loophole in the law to stockpile weapons commonly used in crime & killing.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Finally, federal regulations recognize the deadly truth: a homemade gun is still a gun. Just ask anyone who has lost a loved one to a so-called ghost gun; they shoot like guns & they kill like guns. But they have not been treated as guns under federal law—until today. https://t.co/7ilvRBQCpa

name: Richard Blumenthal

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: I agree w/Gov Pierluisi: Our fellow Americans in Puerto Rico deserve a power system worthy of America, accountability for mismanagement, & federal investment to avoid these unacceptable outages. I’ll continue to fight for fair treatment & federal resources.https://t.co/jof7KXDQgh

name: Richard Blumenthal

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Hearts of CT firefighters go out to Ukrainians braving bullets & bombs to fight fires resulting from murderous Russian shelling & missile strikes aimed at civilians. “The least we can do,” one tells me. Thank you!

name: Richard Blumenthal

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Honored to participate in this beautiful Ramadan Iftar at Ahmadiyya Muslim Community Baitul Aman Mosque in Meriden. It’s theme of “Justice Through Compassion” has deep meaning for all faiths. Thank you for your warm welcome & friendship.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Wonderfully inspiring Girls With Impact event showcased powerfully impressive young women—entrepreneurs, students, community leaders & more. Trailblazers & ceiling breakers, they’re role models.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Patience wanes, frustration mounts—understandably—among gun violence prevention advocates. Mine does too. The President’s goals & intentions are good. The administration needs to execute—utilizing executive power. Use presidential authority sooner rather than later.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Time for action on gun violence without more delay. Steps President Biden can—& must take: finalize a ghost gun rule, establish a GVP office & czar, nominate a strong ATF Director, expand funds for community intervention, & more. He has the power. He should use it to save lives.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: A massive loss for the Courant & CT, @markmirko is a true photojournalist asking probing questions while capturing historic moments. Best wishes Mark, the Courant won’t be the same without you.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text:
Ketanji Brown Jackson is making #SCOTUS history. 

She will bring to the bench top-notch qualifications, impeccable character, & a record of impartiality. 

I am proud & honored to vote YES on her final confirmation. #ConfirmKBJ

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: My recent trips to the region convince me that we must do more—planes, tanks, air defense missiles, etc. But also broader, deeper economic sanctions, covering ALL Russian banks, all who finance Putin’s war machine, & tougher export controls—keep increasing pressure on Putin.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Time is desperately short before Putin's WWII Victory Day parade, May 9, when Putin must show tangible success to his people. More military aid must be rushed—even more than promised, more quickly—to hinder Putin's disinformation campaign & reveal his failures.

name: Richard Blumenthal
text: Invoke the Defense Production Act to produce more lethal military support for Ukraine, speed delivery to front, backfill allies’ stockpiles & prevent our own supplies from running low—Javelin/Stinger missiles, anti-aircraft systems, & more. Spare no effort.https://t.co/9o1JcqXvtR

The next generation of mail trucks should be powered by American clean energy, not oil priced at the whims of foreign dictators.

4 years ago today, after tragedy in Parkland, students from across the country took purpose from pain, & organized #MarchForOurLives—one of the largest protests in U.S. history.

On today's anniversary, I'm urging Congress to finally pass common-sense gun laws.

name: Senator Tom Carper
text:
After several long days of questioning, it’s clear Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson would add a poised, evenhanded, and phenomenally experienced voice to our nation’s highest court.
 
I’ll be honored to vote to confirm her to the Supreme Court.

name: Senator Tom Carper
text:
Madeline Albright was a trailblazing leader & brilliant public servant who fled fascism as a refugee and became a champion for democracy & human rights around the world. Her legacy is profoundly important today and for generations to come. 

My prayers are with her loved ones.

name: Senator Tom Carper
text:
12 years ago, the ACA was signed into law, expanding access to affordable care & protecting millions of Americans with pre-existing conditions.


Today, we celebrate the over 30 million Americans who gained coverage thanks to the ACA—including nearly 35,000 in the First State!

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: We cannot reflect on the horrors of the past today without recognizing the horrors of the present. And we cannot commemorate this solemn day and declare “never again” without doing our part to grapple with the genocide in Ukraine.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: When we say #NeverAgain today, we do so in the shadow of the mass graves in Bucha and Mariupol, and the knowledge that that half of Ukraine’s children – boys and girls who were Madeleine’s age – have been displaced by Russia’s brutal invasion.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Today, let us remember the 6.5 million Jews who were killed by the Nazis, but also the countless others whose lives were uprooted and destroyed in an effort to eliminate European Jewry.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Thinking today on #YomHashoah about how we laid Secretary Albright to rest yesterday, and how one of the world’s great advocates for freedom and democracy first had to flee to America as a child to escape the horrors of the Shoah in Europe.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: On my CODEL last week, we met with Ukrainian refugees or organizations that advocate for them everywhere we went. Russia has displaced over half of Ukraine’s children; as part of our commitment to them, we must fund aid to care for the stranger and the orphan in our midst. https://t.co/wJQnYtmIem

name: Senator Chris Coons

Most Americans may want to be done with COVID-19, but COVID-19 isn't done with us—and it won't be until we help vaccinate the rest of the world.

name: Senator Chris Coons

name: Senator Chris Coons

He is Risen! 

As families in Delaware and across the world gather together to celebrate Easter, it is my hope that we remember Jesus’ radical message to love and care for the widow, the stranger and the orphan in our midst. May you have a blessed and fulfilling day.

name: Senator Chris Coons

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
Supreme Court decisions impact the lives of millions of Americans and the health of our system of democracy and the rule of law – it matters who sits on this Court and takes part in these decisions. 

Congratulations, Justice Jackson!

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
I was honored to vote to confirm Ketanji Brown Jackson to the United States Supreme Court.

Justice Jackson has a deep understanding of the Constitution, a balanced judicial temperament, and a great sense of the role of a judge in our constitutional democracy.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
We just moved to send Ketanji Brown Jackson to a final confirmation vote later this afternoon.

Next stop for this eminently qualified judge: The United States Supreme Court. https://t.co/xBqXmOzpKa

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Lowest jobless claims in 54 years and 7.9 million jobs created. The numbers speak for themselves: America is back to work. Now we must continue to lower costs so that families can feel comfortable that each dollar they earn goes far enough.

text:
I'm speaking now on the floor of the U.S. Senate about the need to continue funding a robust global response to COVID. Tune in here ➡️ https://t.co/9lQAcZvBNe

We may be done with the virus, but the virus isn't done with us.

text: Proud to vote AYE for Judge Jackson in the Judiciary Committee this afternoon. She knows how important our Constitution and the rule of law are for every American. I’m looking forward to the final vote and hoping to see support from across the aisle for this terrific nominee.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I’d like to thank those colleagues of mine, including Senator Schumer, who joined me in fighting for international funding in this package. Unfortunately, despite tireless efforts, the bill will not include any of those funds.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I am deeply disappointed by the outcome of negotiations on the COVID-19 emergency supplemental package announced today, a short-sighted agreement that contains not a penny to distribute vaccines around the world to prevent the emergence of more deadly and transmissible variants.

text: Today I proudly joined @DrBiden, @POTUS, and the crew of USS Delaware for its official commissioning ceremony in Wilmington. text:
Another month, another strong jobs report!

Unemployment is at near all-time lows, and @POTUS continues to set records for the most jobs created by any president 15 months into his term. 

Each day, more and more Americans are back to work.

text:

text: Trans rights are human rights. Today on #TransDayofVisibility, we celebrate the trans and non-binary community. We see you, we value you, and we love you. I will continue to fight to make sure you are accepted everywhere just as you are.

name: Senator Chris Coons

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I continue to watch the situation on the ground for evidence of improvements in humanitarian access and steps towards sustainable peace. Last week’s announcement must represent a step away from the brink – the lives of millions of Ethiopians depend on it.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: If the humanitarian truce and ceasefire is upheld, this bill will not be necessary. I pray it won't be, and as long as this peace continues, I'll work to make sure this bill goes no further. However, my colleagues and I must be ready to pass this bill swiftly if fighting resumes.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: While I've been encouraged by Addis' announcement of a humanitarian truce and the TPLF's agreement to a ceasefire last week, I still voted to advance an amended version of the Ethiopia Peace and Stabilization Act to punish parties who continue to fuel the conflict. Here's why:

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: This is no small feat. The $17.5M going to the @DelawareNG for a new fuel cell corrosion and control hangar is the culmination of a 20-year process, and our congressional delegation was able to secure its funding as part of the $97M coming to Delaware for other key projects. https://t.co/fL8HNv91gq

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: President Biden’s budget would strengthen supply chains, empower innovative entrepreneurs, and lower prices for everyday Americans.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Since @POTUS took office, our economy has added more than 423k manufacturing jobs. I’m glad to see President Biden's new budget will continue this dynamic growth by continuing to make smart investments in American manufacturing.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
I was pleased the Biden administration took action this week to sanction Sudan’s Central Reserve Police over the crackdown on protestors. 

I hope to see additional sanctions on military leaders & their networks to force the regime to change course and restore civilian rule. ⤵️ https://t.co/yplEQbwjIt

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Just checking. https://t.co/0jw2LwETc7

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I believe Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson will make an outstanding Supreme Court Justice, but don't just take my word for it: across the political spectrum, the best and brightest of the legal community support her confirmation. https://t.co/N9JcsMLiKt

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I always counted on her for an engaging, lively conversation that would teach me something and challenge me to be a better leader. It pains me to know to that I’ll never have one of those conversations again. https://t.co/MSwJ6y87AP

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I am deeply saddened to hear of the passing of my friend and mentor, former U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, a giant of American diplomacy and a fierce advocate for democracy and human rights.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: "You [are] a jurist who understands her commitment above all to determining what the law requires and then following it. In my view, that's exactly the kind of individual who belongs on this Court."

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I'm starting my second round of questioning of #SCOTUS Nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson with @JudiciaryDems. Tune in now ➡️ https://t.co/c8YfG8ZKly https://t.co/XhMhK9murT

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
The real question that the American people want to know: what kind of Justice will Ketanji Brown Jackson be? 

With her 9 years on the federal bench, Jackson has consistently demonstrated she is both fair and faithful to the rule of law. https://t.co/TpbwNib6tf

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: I’m proud of how the American Rescue Plan has built on the ACA by making coverage more affordable for many American families during COVID, and on this anniversary of the ACA’s package, we should recommit ourselves to extending that support for years to come.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: In the 12 years since the Affordable Care Act was enacted, 30 million Americans gained access to health care & pre-existing conditions protections are now covered.

name: Senator Chris Coons
text:
It's clear to me that Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson is judicious and even-handed. 

She has a demonstrated record of excellence. https://t.co/GZzPevMXgZ

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson isn't some radical—as numerous respected Republican-appointed judges have said, she's even-handed and impartial. https://t.co/csWOVIuFAR

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: "You plainly understand the reason why the robes of a federal judge are black and not red or blue... No wonder that when you came before this body to be confirmed for the District and then the Circuit Court, you earned and received bipartisan support."

name: Senator Chris Coons
text: "Your experience is extensive and broad, your commitment to follow the law impartially and without the influence of politics is evident in your record, and your keen legal mind, judicial temperament, and impeccable character are plain to all."

name: Senator Chris Coons

Greater love has no one than this, that one should lay down his life for his friends.

text:
Lowering insulin costs should not be a partisan issue. That's why I'm glad that my effort to cap insulin costs was just included in the bipartisan insulin proposal. 

It's time we get this done.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text:
Our children are leaving college owing the equivalent of a mortgage before they even own a home and have a mortgage. 

We've got to relieve student debt. It'll lower people’s burdens and spur entrepreneurship.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: It's the start of #BlackMaternalHealthWeek and I'm proud the government funding package included my maternal health bill. I'll always fight for more resources to combat maternal mortality here in Georgia.

text: Georgians can’t wait another day for more affordable prescriptions. I urge my colleagues in Congress to join my bill and help get it across the finish line.

text: My Capping Drug Costs for Seniors Act would put the burden of high costs on pharmaceutical companies who are raking in profits while Georgians are rationing their medicine to make ends meet.

text: Glad the Biden Administration listened and extended the pause on student loan payments. We need them to do more to relieve the burden of student debt that is gripping a generation. You can count on me to keep pushing for it.

Associate Justice of the Supreme Court Ketanji Brown Jackson 🙌🏾

text: Today's the day we confirm Judge Jackson. Let's do this.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Thank you for putting your faith in me, Georgia. With your help, I'll head back to Washington in November to continue representing all Georgians in the U.S. Senate! Text REV to 52005 to stand with me.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Judge Jackson has proven she is fit to serve on the Supreme Court and I hope my colleagues will join me in voting for her confirmation.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text:
I hear from families at my church about how they're paying record prices for their medicines. But corporations have been reporting record profits. This isn't right. 

We need to make prescription drugs more affordable and prevent companies from taking advantage of Georgians.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: My legislation to cap prescription drug costs for seniors matters because medicine only works if people can afford it.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Last week I signed-on to a bill that would help combat corporate greed from oil companies while providing relief to working families. Oil companies shouldn't be able to take advantage of Georgians at the pump.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Basic essentials should be affordable. My Relief for Families Act would help make that happen.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Medicaid expansion in Georgia would expand access to affordable health care for 640,000 Georgians (and create over 60,000 jobs). Let's expand Medicaid and get folks the coverage they need.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson will soon become JUSTICE Ketanji Brown Jackson. I am proud to support her nomination to the Supreme Court of the United States.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: The ASSIST Act is my bill to hire and retain mental health providers in schools. Let's normalize conversations around mental health and get folks the assistance they deserve.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Mental health care IS health care and expanding access for all Georgians is a priority for me.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text:
Mental health matters.

When I was in high school, I was a teen peer counselor. I was selected and trained by the Georgia Department of Human Resources to listen to my peers, to get them some help, and to provide support. 

My work on these issues continues today in the Senate.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: I'm honored to have made history as Georgia's first Black U.S. Senator. Serving folks in every corner of our state is the honor of my life, but my work is far from done. name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text:
Honored to have been at the White House yesterday as the Emmett Till Antilynching Act was signed into law, making lynching a federal hate crime. 

After many failed attempts to pass similar legislation in Congress, it's a remarkable thing to finally see progress.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: Too often, Georgians are forced to choose between paying for their prescription drugs or putting food on the table. The fact that this choice is necessary is unconscionable and immoral. Medicine needs to be affordable.

text:
