name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: “Justice Jackson” has a nice ring to it.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text: As the father of a young Black girl, seeing my daughter watch Judge Jackson step into this moment is witnessing the moral arc of history bend before our very eyes.

name: Reverend Raphael Warnock
text:
I am so excited to announce that I will proudly support Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court.

I look forward to calling her Justice.

name: Brian Schatz
text: @RyanGigous @DaviSusan I have a very good bill that gets at this problem. I don’t think we will solve this bigger picture problem without creating some downward pressure on price.

name: Brian Schatz
text: @DaviSusan Thanks for the engagement. FWIW I mildly disagree re twitter. I’ve had several good exchanges and a lot of it comes down to whether or not we  decide to exchange views rather than dunk on each other. Not that I’m above a dunk.

name: Brian Schatz
text: @DaviSusan Respectfully, your first tweet was not an accurate re my position. I don’t want to go to war over this or anything I just think that I should get to decide what I’m saying - and no one gets to impute a “subtext” onto my communication.

name: Brian Schatz
text: @DaviSusan But that’s literally not what your first tweet says. I have a hearing, turning phone off FYI

name: Brian Schatz
text: @DaviSusan There’s a big difference between something that isn’t worth anything and something that is too expensive and not dischargeable in bankruptcy. So, let’s say you bought a Tacoma for 200k. Not worthless, but a bad deal.

text: @DaviSusan I’m sorry what?

text: Border Patrol agents told me this weekend, “we have the capacity to handle 5,000 people per day. Right now, we’re getting close to 8,000 per day. When the Biden Admin ends Title 42, we’re afraid we’ll be at 15,000 per day.” Ending Title 42 during a record crisis is madness.

name: Tammy Duckworth
text:
Four police officers took their lives following the Jan. 6 insurrection.

Erin Smith, a widow of one of those officers, told @macfarlanenews her husband had no history of mental health issues or depression before that day: “If he didn’t go to work that day, he’d still be here.” https://t.co/JdkzJm4ZgU

name: Tammy Duckworth
text:
Within months of the insurrection, four officers on duty that day died by suicide—Erin Smith's husband Jeff included. That is no coincidence.

Erin and I agree: it’s time we pass my bill to treat law enforcement suicides as line-of-duty deaths.
https://t.co/fjjfWi90B3

name: Tammy Duckworth
text: BREAKING: After more than 200 failed attempts to outlaw lynching at the federal level, President Biden just signed the Emmett Till Antilynching Act into law. This sends a powerful message that hate has no place here.

name: Tammy Duckworth
text:
Emmett Till was 14-years-old when he was abducted, beaten and lynched by white supremacists.

Reckoning with our nation’s long history of lynching that persists to this day is overdue.

Today, @POTUS will sign legislation in Emmett's name to *finally* make it a federal crime.

name: Tammy Duckworth
text: Budgets are statements of values, and President Biden’s values are clear: he wants to lower costs for working families, protect our country and rebuild our nation and infrastructure like never before.

text: Democrats' economic policies helped recover 19.9 million jobs of the 22 million that were lost during the pandemic. That’s 90% of jobs recovered.

name: Tammy Duckworth
text:
As a result of our unprecedented sanctions, the ruble was almost immediately reduced to rubble.
 
The Russian economy is on track to be cut in half.
 
It was ranked the 11th biggest economy in the world before this invasion — and soon, it will not even rank among the top 20.

name: Senator Dick Durbin
text: On his 100th birthday, Illinois celebrates the life of a great Chicagoan, Harold Washington—the city’s first Black Mayor. His election led to a new era of progressive politics in Chicago and his leadership inspired Chicagoans of all backgrounds.

name: Senator Dick Durbin

name: Senator Dick Durbin

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: Millions of people have benefited from the medical advances and protections derived from Henrietta Lacks’ cells. I’m proud to help lead this effort with Senator @ChrisVanHollen to award the Congressional Gold Medal in recognition of the tremendous impact of her life and legacy. https://t.co/fcK9c9GIUd

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text:
Read more on the legacy of Henrietta Lacks here:
https://t.co/UcAY2UGmdf

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: The whole world has benefitted from Henrietta Lacks, including the development of U.S. privacy laws in health care. I am proud to work for her and honor her with a Congressional Gold Medal.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text:
In 2013, after 62 years of research and 62 years since Lacks’ death, Lacks’ family was granted some control over how her genome was being used.
 
Lacks’ story led to the rewriting of the rules around ethics in health care, including patient privacy and consent.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text:
Doctors found that Lacks’ cells could thrive in a lab and were shipped around the world as the subject of 74k+ studies.
 
Her family did not know that her cells were alive or being used. The cells, called HeLa cells, laid the base for the multibillion-dollar biotech industry.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: In 1951, Henrietta Lacks was a young mother who went to The Johns Hopkins Hospital, one of the few hospitals that would care for poor Black Americans, to be treated for cancer. While there, health providers removed her cells without her knowledge or consent. https://t.co/2x4SD1nCBS

name: Senator Ben Cardin

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: The challenge of our dangerous roads requires high attention, but the benefits of investing to make our transportation network safer cannot be overstated. Using the #IIJA to its full potential on safety, we will have a stronger, more productive, and healthier economy and country.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: I applaud the @USDOT & @SecretaryPete for announcing in January a new National Roadway Safety Strategy that adopts a long-term goal of zero roadway fatalities and will think through safety across all of the departments programs and authorities. https://t.co/9TG45ujlSi

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: In Maryland in 2021, we lost 377 drivers, 129 pedestrians and bicyclists and 80 passengers. These numbers are unacceptable and we have an opportunity to change course and invest in the infrastructure we need for stronger communities and safer roadways.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: In 2020, when millions of Americans worked from home, we expected a decline in roadways deaths. Tragically, 38,680 people died on our roads in 2020. This number is higher than the annual undergraduate enrollment of the University of Maryland.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: April is Distracted Driving Awareness Month. With a rise in pedestrian and driver deaths, this is a reminder to put down the phone, slow down, stay focused, be alert and #JustDrive.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: A young man, Freddie Gray, died seven years ago today while in custody of our local law enforcement. This never should have happened and we should all want to make sure that it does not happen again.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: Protecting Marylanders from harm should not come at the expense of civil rights or treating individuals with dignity and respect. We are working at all levels of our community to do better in Baltimore City and across our great state.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: We still have much work to do to heal our city. Despite the concerted efforts of so many to reverse the tide, daily violence continues. A critical lack of trust remains between our police and local communities.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: After the tragic death of #FreddieGray, important steps are being taken to rebuild the necessary trust between Baltimoreans and the Baltimore Police Department. Including identifying and implementing best practices to renew public safety and help officers serve our community.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: The new rule from @POTUS bans the business of manufacturing some of the most accessible ghost gun kits that individuals can buy online or at a store with no background check first. These guns can be assembled at home in as little as 30 minutes.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text: Ghost guns remain a large threat in our country. Due to the lack of serial numbers, law enforcement has a difficult time tracking down the owners of the ghost guns found at crime scenes. Last year, there were 20k ghost guns recovered by law enforcement in criminal investigations.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
text:
Yesterday, @POTUS announced a new federal rule to crack down on “ghost guns.” Many might not know what ghost guns are.

A ghost gun is a gun that can be bought online, assembled at home and has no serial number, making it an untraceable firearm.

name: Ed Markey
text: Congress must pass my Algorithmic Justice and Online Platform Transparency Act to end the online harm inflicted against marginalized communities and put inclusion, equity, and non-discrimination at the forefront of tech policy. 5/5

name: Ed Markey
text: Billionaire tech CEOs’ promises to enhance privacy, improve algorithms, and protect kids are useless. The only way to imbue our values into today’s technologies is to end the era of failed self-regulation and enact laws. 4/5

name: Ed Markey
text: These algorithms are responsible for glaring discrimination and bias. Evidence shows that Facebook has limited people of different races and religions from seeing housing ads and Google has excluded transgender or non-binary people from job search results. The list goes on. 3/5

name: Ed Markey
text: Social media algorithms leverage the data they collect about us to determine what posts users see. Algorithms are the tools Big Tech uses to keep us glued to their apps and coming back for more, so they can rake in profit. 2/5

name: Ed Markey
text:
If you're just tuning in, algorithmic justice is not new. It's an issue I've worked on for years to address the systemic biases which harm marginalized communities and are disastrous when taken online and baked into Big Tech’s algorithms.

Here's what it's all about. 1/5 https://t.co/DFmnCRLDWT

name: Ed Markey
text: Elon Musk and a handful of billionaires now have dangerous influence over the most powerful online platforms. They can't be trusted, and self-regulation has failed. We must pass laws to protect privacy and promote algorithmic justice for internet users, especially for kids.

name: Ed Markey
text: The climate crisis is here. Now it's up to us to organize, take action, and deliver real solutions and real justice. name: Ed Markey
text: 12 years later and Big Oil is still lying. Oil companies are price gouging American consumers and putting profits over people. Exxon lobbyist, Keith McCoy, openly admitted to fighting against science to boost investor profits. https://t.co/Vej9OAQLEZ

name: Ed Markey
text: Americans only found out the truth when my committee forced BP to share live footage of the leak and broadcast it to the public. name: Ed Markey
text: 12 years ago today the Deepwater Horizon Oil Rig exploded, sending tens of thousands of barrels of oil gushing into the Gulf of Mexico and threatening the health of our oceans and communities. BP lied to cover it up. https://t.co/AlqNBxhRyp

name: Ed Markey
text: Big Oil is lying to Americans and we won't take it anymore. We can only build a world rooted in equity and justice if we reject Big Oil's lies and invest boldly in climate action to create millions of good jobs and secure a clean energy future. https://t.co/hJacOY0YI9

name: Ed Markey
text: Devastating warming pollution shouldn’t get a get-out-of-monitoring-free card. We need a clean energy revolution that turns fossil fuels into ancient history. And as we transition, we must monitor, measure, and manage our infrastructure to make sure more disasters don’t happen. https://t.co/673gGtqRC3

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: Cheating consumers is simply in Wells Fargo’s DNA. The Fed has the power to break Wells Fargo up & should do it now. I’m also reintroducing my Corporate Executive Accountability Act to hold bank executives personally liable when the companies they run repeatedly break the law.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
In 2018, regulators capped Wells' growth. It wasn’t enough. Since then, Wells:
▪️ Closed accounts without authorization, damaging credit & continuing to charge overdraft fees 
▪️ Recommended unsuitable products to investors
▪️ Put 1,600 customers into forbearance without consent

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
▪️ Wells Fargo forced consumers to buy unneeded car insurance
▪️ They changed the information on customers’ documents without authorization 
▪️ And they illegally repossessed cars from service members

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: In 2016, Wells Fargo’s fake accounts scandal was exposed. The bank created 3 1/2 million unauthorized bank accounts. But the fine they paid was just a slap on the wrist. And over the next few months, more scandals came to light:

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: We've got to break up @WellsFargo. Here's why: https://t.co/L6KTCkKcPY

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: Senate Republicans want to raise taxes on 50% of hard-working Americans. But the American people strongly support Democratic proposals to raise taxes on billionaires. We need to make sure the ultra-rich pay their fair share just like everyone else.

name: Elizabeth Warren

text:

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
Black Americans are nearly four times more likely than white Americans to be arrested for cannabis possession, despite similar rates of use. 

I've been urging @POTUS to use his authority to decriminalize cannabis use & pardon non-violent cannabis offenses. It's the right thing.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: The lack of competition in our markets gives large companies too much power in Washington — this is a real threat to our democracy. Big monopolies squeeze profits from our economy, then spend billions to rig the rules in their favor. We must strengthen our antitrust laws.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
Now more than ever, Americans need to know Senators and Representatives in Washington are working for them, not for their own personal interests. 

I have a bipartisan, common-sense solution to ban Members of Congress from owning or trading individual stocks.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
Nice work, @SecCardona and @UnderSecKvaal!

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: Happy tax day to those who celebrate! Annual reminder that all the time & money you spent filing your return is a giant scam, courtesy of the tax preparation industry’s lobbying. In many countries, tax returns are pre-populated. For most people it takes a few minutes to file.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: Let’s fully fund the IRS so it can go after wealthy tax cheats, and make tax filing simple and free for honest hardworking Americans. #TaxDay https://t.co/dyGFn9GKBJ

text:

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
Billionaires are sitting on rapidly growing piles of wealth — but pay lower tax rates on average than working families.

We need to #TaxBillionaires.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
Spent too much time and money filing taxes this year? Blame @Intuit & the former regulators its hired to defend its “free” tax filing scams. On #TaxDay, I'm demanding answers about this revolving door. I also have a proposal to make tax filing easy & free.
https://t.co/mfvwj0Qk6j

name: Elizabeth Warren

name: Elizabeth Warren
text: Supreme Court Justices shouldn’t rule in cases where they have conflicts of interest—and they shouldn’t own or trade individual stocks either. We need to reform our judicial ethics system.

name: Elizabeth Warren
text:
You know the tax system is broken when billionaires pay lower rates than teachers or nurses.
 
We can't invest in our country by letting a tiny fraction of the richest people game the system. It's time for a #WealthTax in America.

Last night, Republicans once again attacked reproductive health care, trying to reinstate a Trump-era Title X gag rule that would deny women access to things like birth control and health screenings. I voted NO. 

I will never stop fighting against these attacks.

name: Amy Klobuchar
text: Since Texas passed its six-week abortion ban, thousands of women each month have left the state to access reproductive care. Laws like this are being enacted in states across America. The time to stand up and fight is now.

name: Amy Klobuchar

name: Senator Tina Smith

There have been over 200 failed attempts to make lynching a federal crime since 1900.
 
Last night, the Senate unanimously passed the Emmett Till Antilynching Act and it is now headed to Biden’s desk to be signed into law. This is long overdue. Proud to have supported this bill.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
This is exactly why clean energy is powerful. No country can tell us when the sun can shine or the wind can blow.
 
If we want to be serious about energy independence, fossil fuels are not the path to freedom. Diversifying and shifting rapidly to clean energy is the way to go.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
The obvious solution here, if we don't want Putin to have a say in our energy prices, is to shift to energy that Putin can't control.
 
Fortunately, we have some great options. Clean ones too.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
The goal is to not rely on places like Putin's Russia, so only focusing on oil and gas makes no sense.
 
Russia has a lot of oil and gas, and those prices are set globally. So no matter what the U.S. does, Putin will always have a lot of control over how much fossil fuels cost.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
There's been a lot of talk about the need for energy independence.
 
I agree. And the Biden team is moving to maximize U.S. fossil production in the near term. That is fine, but the way forward to true independence is getting energy from clean sources.

Here's why. [Short Thread]

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: A strong and necessary demonstration of leadership by President Biden. I support banning Russian oil. Let’s remember that Republicans also support the ban and called for this action.

The Job Protections Act would do just that, and I'll keep pushing with @RepUnderwood to pass it.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
Great news out of today’s job report. There were over 600,000 jobs added in just the last month and the unemployment rate is now down to 3.8%.
 
The American Rescue Plan is working. I’m going to keep pushing in the Senate to pass serious legislation and keep up the momentum.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: It’s my birthday today. I’m turning 64, or as we like to call it in the Senate: middle-aged.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Did you know only 56% of the U.S. workforce is protected under Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA)? Today, I introduced The Job Protection Act with  @SenTinaSmith to ensure every worker is covered under the FMLA, ensuring every worker and family has access to crucial protections. https://t.co/Ruk6uoR1Rn

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Welcome back my friend. https://t.co/6J5iprLnJM

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:

Stop by anytime Mr. President, you are always welcome in Minnesota. https://t.co/ZJc17Hhw3K

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
No other country can tell us when the sun can shine or the wind can blow.
 
If the build-out of clean energy is not the very definition of energy independence, I don't know what is.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
President Biden is bringing the country together. He's marshaled the resources we need to get our economy growing.

Looking forward to hearing his State of the Union address tonight.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: We’ve got one of the best Senators in the business. Thank you, @SenTinaSmith, @mncreditunions always appreciate your time, your support and your partnership in working to help Minnesotans achieve their financial goals and live their best lives. https://t.co/GWWlsLXBsK

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
Just spoke w/ @SenTinaSmith. Here's what she says about tonight's SOTU:
"Tonight we're going to hear the President talking about the war in Ukraine, the worst war in Europe since WWII. I think we've all been so inspired by the resistance of the Ukrainians and President Zelensky."

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
My virtual guest for the State of the Union will be the Mayor of Rochester: Kim Norton.

Thanks for being my “+1” @MayorNorton. Looking forward to watching tonight.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:

As the only Senator who worked at Planned Parenthood, I'll keep pushing to protect the freedom of all women to receive the reproductive health care they need. https://t.co/VXqXbSMLgZ

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Providing advice and consent on Supreme Court nominations is one of my most important responsibilities as a United States Senator, and I look forward to meeting with Judge Jackson and reviewing her record.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: This is an exciting and historic nomination; if confirmed, she would be the first Black woman and first former federal public defender on the Supreme Court.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson is exceptionally well-qualified to serve on the Supreme Court, and her demonstrated commitment to defending the constitutional and civil rights of all Americans makes her an outstanding choice of nominee.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: I commend the Biden administration for leading a unified front with our NATO allies to impose swift and severe sanctions that will dramatically weaken Russia’s economic and strategic positions.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Russia must be held accountable for this blatant and illegal aggression, and I will continue to stand in solidarity with the Ukrainian people as they defend their country.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text: Russia’s premeditated and unprovoked invasion of Ukraine, a sovereign democratic nation, is an affront to freedom and democracy around the world. Putin’s decision to launch this unjustified war will cause catastrophic loss of life and human suffering.

name: Senator Tina Smith
text:
Proposed clean energy tax credits would reduce electric bills by billions per year over the next decade. And over time, those savings would only increase. 

That's countless Americans with lower energy bills month after month. All we have to do is get it passed.

text: It's the job of the @US_FDA to protect patients by ensuring the safety of drugs. I intend to seek review of the data behind the decision to broaden access to chemical abortion pills. There is plenty of evidence showing these drugs are dangerous to women.

text: See my full statement on the death of Senator @OrrinHatch here. https://t.co/HBYMIZChb8

name: Senator Roger Wicker
text: It was an honor to know Orrin and serve with him in the Senate. Gayle and I extend our deepest condolences to his wife Elaine and their entire family.

name: Senator Roger Wicker
text: He was also creative – a prolific songwriter and an accomplished author in his own right. It is hard to express how much he will be missed.

name: Senator Roger Wicker
text: Orrin was already an icon by the time I met him. I immediately found him to be one of the most kind, generous, and genuine people in Washington. He would bend over backwards to help you, and he did that for me many times.

name: Senator Roger Wicker
text: Orrin Hatch was a giant of the Senate and a rare statesman. But even more, he was simply a wonderful man to know.

name: Josh Hawley
text: So far, the Sentencing Commission has refused to turn over all Judge Jackson’s records from her time there. In light of what we have learned, this stonewalling must end. We must get access to all relevant records

name: Josh Hawley
text: This is a disturbing record for any judge, but especially one nominated to the highest court in the land. Protecting the most vulnerable shouldn’t be up for debate. Sending child predators to jail shouldn’t be controversial.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Savage, the sex offender was convicted of travel with intent to engage in illicit sexual conduct, and also admitted to transporting child porn. The Guidelines recommended 46-57 months. Judge Jackson gave him 37.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Sears, the sex offender distributed more than 102 child porn videos. He also sent lewd pictures of his own 10-year-old daughter. The Guidelines recommended 97-121 months in prison. Judge Jackson gave him 71 months.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Downs, the perp posted multiple images to an anonymous instant messaging app, including an image of a child under the age of 5. The Guidelines recommended 70-87 months. Judge Jackson gave him the lowest sentence allowed by law, 60 months

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Chazin, the offender had 48 files of child porn, which he had accessed over a period of years. The Guidelines recommended 78-97 months. Judge Jackson gave him 28.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Cooper, in which the criminal had more than 600 images and videos and posted many on a public blog, the Guidelines called for a sentence of 151-188 months. Judge Jackson settled on 60 months, the lowest possible sentence allowed by law.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In United States v. Stewart, the criminal possessed thousands of images of child porn and also hoped to travel across state lines to abuse a 9-year-old girl. The Guidelines called for a sentence of 97-121 months. Judge Jackson sentenced the criminal to just 57 months.

name: Josh Hawley
text: In the case of United States v. Hawkins, the sex offender had multiple images of child porn. He was over 18. The Sentencing Guidelines called for a sentence of up to 10 years. Judge Jackson sentenced the perpetrator to only 3 months in prison. Three months.

name: Josh Hawley
text: On the federal bench, Judge Jackson put her troubling views into action. In every single child porn case for which we can find records, Judge Jackson deviated from the federal sentencing guidelines in favor of child porn offenders

name: Josh Hawley
text: In her time on the U.S. Sentencing Commission, Judge Jackson said she “mistakingly assumed that child pornography offenders are pedophiles” and she wanted “to understand this category of nonpedophiles who obtain child pornography.” https://t.co/ZM16VAqpLo

name: Josh Hawley
text: Judge Jackson has opined there may be a type of “less-serious child pornography offender” whose motivation is not sexual but “is the challenge, or to use the technology.” A “less-serious” child porn offender? https://t.co/2bb1rZuTXW

name: Josh Hawley
text: Judge Jackson has said that some people who possess child porn “are in this for either the collection, or the people who are loners and find status in their participation in the community.” What community would that be? The community of child exploiters? https://t.co/JDxqf9Q1AH

name: Josh Hawley
text: It gets worse. As a member of the U.S. Sentencing Commission, Judge Jackson advocated for drastic change in how the law treats sex offenders by eliminating the existing mandatory minimum sentences for child porn

name: Josh Hawley
text: Judge Jackson has also questioned sending dangerous sex offenders to civil commitment. We have a civil commitment law in Missouri, and it protects children

name: Josh Hawley
text: As far back as her time in law school, Judge Jackson has questioned making convicts register as sex offenders - saying it leads to “stigmatization and ostracism.” She’s suggested public policy is driven by a “climate of fear, hatred & revenge” against sex offenders https://t.co/2QUcPOnWPR

name: Josh Hawley
text: Judge Jackson has a pattern of letting child porn offenders off the hook for their appalling crimes, both as a judge and as a policymaker. She’s been advocating for it since law school. This goes beyond “soft on crime.” I’m concerned that this a record that endangers our children

name: Senator Jon Tester

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: "Capitalism works well in a free market. It does not work well in a consolidated market," says @SenatorTester in opening comments to the Committee.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: .@SenatorTester testifying before the committee as a sponsor of both bills before the committee: With industry consolidation, we see the opportunity for food to become a serious problem ini this country.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
AG NEWS: Tomorrow, the Senate Ag Committee will review two of my bipartisan bills.

My Meat Packing Special Investigator Act and my Cattle Price Discovery and Transparency Act are both critical to cracking down on consolidation in the industry—it's time to get them passed.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
This helps our ongoing fight in Congress to provide toxic-exposed vets their long-overdue health care and benefits.

While we still need to pass comprehensive toxic exposure legislation as quickly as possible, I encourage every eligible veteran to file a claim today.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: It’s a big day for veterans suffering from conditions related to military toxic exposures. I appreciate VA for taking steps to do right by these veterans by establishing presumptive conditions for nine rare respiratory conditions covered under my comprehensive COST of War Act. https://t.co/QHZRzbbcXu

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
As @SVACDems Chairman, I sent a letter last week urging VA Secretary McDonough for more transparency with the Program to help us hold the VA accountable and ensure we're adequately supporting caregivers like Dara in Montana and throughout the nation.

They deserve nothing less.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
The Department also announced a plan to refine the eligibility requirements to ensure the Caregivers Program is meeting the intent of Congress.

I was glad to see the Biden Administration take our concerns and the concerns of veterans and caregivers across the country seriously.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Together, we held VA's feet to the fire.

We held hearings. We sent letters. We got input from VA officials, VSOs, and caregivers on how to improve the Program.

And just last month, VA announced a slew of changes—including a halt on discharging legacy participants.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
A few years ago, the previous administration was set to tighten the Program's eligibility requirements and unfairly deny access.

Hearing concerns from veterans and caregivers alike, I raised hell—but they did it anyways.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Tomy and Dara are two of many Montanans who know firsthand how vital the Caregivers Program is to our vets. Tomy sacrificed a whole lot for our country, and Dara had to work part-time to help him get the care he deserved.

But Tomy and Dara were almost kicked from the program. 🧵 https://t.co/m2Xtd7hUDu

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: As the Senate returns from a state work period, one of my top priorities will be leveraging my role on the America COMPETES Act conference committee to strengthen our supply chain, defend our economic advantage over China, and bring down costs for Montana families.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
There's no good reason to continue reduced hours of operation at points of entry along our northern border.

Operations at these ports are critical to our supply chain and economic growth in Montana's northern tier. @CBP needs to fully reopen our ports.
https://t.co/ww8yh2pXbm

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Senator Orrin Hatch was a great American who served the people of Utah honorably for decades. Sharla and I are saddened to hear of his passing, and we send our condolences to his family.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Tackling consolidation in the ag industry is critical to getting our ranchers a fair shake and bringing down the cost of meat at the grocery store.

Good to see American Rescue Plan resources are going to this fight—now let's get my price transparency bill over the finish line. https://t.co/yAvzEBgCPY

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
The Senate wasn't in session this week, but the work didn't stop. In case you missed it, here's what we secured this week:

🚰 Another $127M for MT water projects
🔥 $19.3M for wildfire mitigation
🎒 $14M for rural MT schools & roads
🐟 $1.5M for MT fish passage projects

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Good news ahead of fire season—we've secured $19.3 million from my bipartisan infrastructure law for wildfire mitigation in the Kootenai National Forest.

We've got to do all we can to combat and mitigate wildfire damage. Montanans' homes and drinking water are at risk.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Happy Earth Day from the Last Best Place! We're renting this land from our future generations, and we owe it to our kids and grandkids to leave this Earth a little better than we found it. https://t.co/Rh1wSNLkO1

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: @SenatorTester believes it's a "mistake" to keep curtailing economic traffic across the U.S.-Canadian border, and calls on Customs and Border Patrol to resume full hours of operation for border crossings. https://t.co/vzSzHNflpu https://t.co/YpqtJpFvM5

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
The American Rescue Plan keeps on delivering for Montanans—this time with another $127 million for water infrastructure projects across the state.

These upgrades are long overdue. For our communities to have economic certainty and job growth, we need reliable water systems.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
🆕 We've secured more than $1.5 million from my bipartisan infrastructure law for Montana fish passage projects.

When it comes to preserving our public lands and powering our outdoor recreation economy, clean water and wildlife conservation are essential.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
We’ve got to do more to connect veterans with life-saving mental health care.

My Hannon Act created a new suicide prevention grant program that’ll do just that, and I encourage eligible organizations, Tribes, and local governments to apply today:
https://t.co/xEhTbZLV81

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
For too long, consolidation in the meatpacking industry has squeezed Montana's family ranchers out of business.

Capitalism only works when there's competition. That's why I fought to help boost our local small ag businesses with the American Rescue Plan.
https://t.co/HQgIAcw1L4

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Good to be out at Tenmile Creek Park with the Prickly Pear Land Trust and the Montana Army National Guard. This project is great for a lot of reasons, but especially for the work they've done to connect with Fort Harrison and create public access for our local veterans. https://t.co/7gr8JM9S3W

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Old-Salt Co-Op is helping Montana ranchers expand their markets and bring the world's best meat right to the consumer. They're one of 30 small ag businesses across our state that received American Rescue Plan resources that I fought for to boost competition and processing power. https://t.co/zWnn5JfNM7

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Montana's Community Health Centers work hard to reduce barriers and get folks the care they need—and Helena's Purview Health Center is no exception.

Was honored to tour the new clinic this morning and receive an award from @NACHC. I'll always fight to keep our CHCs strong. https://t.co/FysMLzZPES

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
In rural areas like Montana, we rely on law enforcement agencies with fewer officers to keep folks safe across larger areas.

Smaller agencies need access to proper funding without unnecessary red tape. That's what our bipartisan Invest to Protect Act is for—let's get it done.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
The American soldiers who fought in the Battle of Dai Do displayed the utmost heroism, gallantry, and determination against stacked odds—and they emerged victorious. It's time we give these brave Marines the recognition and respect they've earned.
https://t.co/HW5qgEZF3q

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
ICYMI: Our bipartisan infrastructure law reauthorized the Secure Rural Schools program and secured more than $14 million for Montana's rural schools, roads, and more.

Rural schools are too often overlooked and underfunded, which is why I fought hard to secure these resources.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: There's no silver bullet, but I’m going to keep working hard on an all of the above, all hands on deck approach to make sure every Montanan has a place to call home.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
When it comes to housing, we not only have an affordability problem—we have a supply problem.

That's why I've fought and will keep fighting to support programs like Owner Built Homes, the Homeowner Assistance Fund, Section 4, Housing Counseling, and more.
https://t.co/4mNrKPoCbG

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: I'm urging @CBP to reopen all Montana ports of entry to pre-pandemic hours. Reduced hours are hurting essential operations along the northern border that are critical to our national security, supply chain, and local economies. It's time to fully reopen our ports. https://t.co/aCmbMzODMy

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: 6 more inches of snow over the Easter weekend. We are so grateful. - Sharla https://t.co/eDC2M9npBR

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Sharla and I have our eggs dyed and our seeds planted, so we're ringing in spring the best way we know how.

Wishing a very happy and healthy Easter to all the Montana families celebrating today.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Friendly reminder: the deadline to file your 2021 tax returns for both federal and Montana state taxes is this Monday, the 18th. Get it done, folks!

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Happy National Park Week, Montana! Get outside and enjoy one of our world-class parks this week. https://t.co/wrEnQYoERv

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Sharla and I wish the best to every Montanan beginning their Passover celebration tonight. Chag Sameach!

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Good to visit with NeighborWorks and the Great Falls Development Authority today. I hear about the unaffordable cost of housing everywhere I go in Montana—and Cascade County is no exception.

We've got to do all we can to make sure Montanans can keep a roof over their heads. https://t.co/8CEfqeAtcU

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
A great day to be in Great Falls! Kicked it off with @KRTV's Shannon Newth, who asked what we're doing to lower costs at the supermarket.

If we pass my bills and get more transparency in cattle markets, not only will it help lower meat prices, it'll get ranchers a fairer shake. https://t.co/2in0yev0Br

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Another major infrastructure investment in Montana: $30M for public transportation🚍

Efficient and affordable public transportation networks are an important driver of our state's economy, and investing in this critical infrastructure will create jobs and keep folks connected.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Great news! Huge congratulations to Beatrix for earning this high honor—you've made Polson, @umontana, and all of Big Sky Country very proud! https://t.co/XeEQpp94UR

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: In a rural state like ours, folks often have to drive for hours to access critical health care. That's why I fought to invest in rural Montana hospitals through the American Rescue Plan—to make it easier for folks to find high-quality emergency care closer to home. https://t.co/EfcrbVuCeE

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: A brisk start to the spring planting season, but much-needed moisture. Sending my best to every Montana farmer working sun up to sun down to produce the food that feeds the world. https://t.co/E8yeDX8lyD

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
It's also critical that we continue addressing supply chain issues, which my bipartisan infrastructure package will do by investing in our ports, rail, roads, and bridges.

I'll keep pushing the Administration to get these investments out the door and into our communities ASAP.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
I'm working to bring costs down for Montana families and businesses by tackling consolidation in the ag industry.

I've got a slew of bills that'll crack down on the anticompetitive practices that are hurting producers and inflating meat prices—it's high time we get them done.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: We have more work to do to lower costs for Montanans on critical items like prescription drugs, housing, and childcare—but make no mistake: corporate monopolies are rooting out competition to drive up the cost of goods on their own terms.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: We are dying our Easter Eggs! So grateful for the wonderful snow received yesterday. - Sharla https://t.co/nfoRILOEES

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: The men and women awarded the Purple Heart represent the very best of Montana and America. This bill will help honor their sacrifices and serve as a lasting reminder of our solemn obligation to provide these brave heroes with the quality care and benefits they've earned. https://t.co/mA2YZizYR4

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
When it comes to basic needs, it doesn't get more basic than water. Rural water systems like the Musselshell-Judith are critical for providing long-term water certainty, and I'm proud to have secured this funding to move this project forward.
https://t.co/LT0uTQ28Tq

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: ICYMI: @SenatorTester, @JohnBoozman, and @Sen_JoeManchin’s bill expanding the @VetAffairsOIG’s authority to strengthen oversight for veterans and taxpayers unanimously cleared the Senate last week. This bill now moves to the House of Representatives for consideration.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Thanks, @TRUCKINGdotORG! It's an honor to fight on behalf of Montana's truckers—the real champions.

In a state like ours, where natural resources are abundant and production agriculture is the #1 industry, truckers play a vital role in helping folks get our goods to market. https://t.co/eCUyPovxVF

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Why are we importing record levels of beef from a country with repeated reporting issues related to Mad Cow Disease?

Brazilian beef imports jeopardize consumer trust and present a serious risk to our domestic cattle producers. I've got a bill to stop these imports—let's pass it. https://t.co/LMHPA9jj5l

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Unfortunately, it's not just Missoula. Everywhere I go in Montana, I hear about the runaway cost of housing.

I'm with the experts—we've got to focus on developing more affordable housing, and Congress needs to act before it's too late.
https://t.co/JABCks3OE8

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Whether it's herding livestock, sounding the alarm, or good old-fashioned pest control, pets still have to earn their keep on the farm. #NationalPetDay https://t.co/iCGYXMzRjf

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
It's important for Montanans to know how their elected leaders are serving them.

If you want to hear more about what I'm fighting for in Washington, or get the occasional update from the farm, sign up to receive my newsletter ⤵️
https://t.co/EkR9QLpd7n

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
By bolstering funding for veteran homelessness, health care, and job training programs, the American Rescue Plan has been a lifeline for many veterans throughout this pandemic—helping them get the critical care and assistance they earned.
https://t.co/BeF40wUBGp

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
This week, @CMSGov announced that Medicare enrollees can now get 8 over-the-counter COVID-19 tests covered per month at no cost.

And all Americans can still have up to 8 free COVID tests per month—delivered right to your door—at https://t.co/OSAlZvoFjt.
https://t.co/egkaI3rCOe

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
The Senate passed my resolution designating April 16-24 as National Park Week.

National Parks are one of the best ideas the government ever had, and Montanans are lucky to have two of the finest right in our backyard.

Plan ahead—park entry will be free of charge on the 16th!

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
🚨 BIG NEWS: We secured a hearing for two of my bipartisan bills to improve transparency and competition in cattle markets.

My Cattle Price Discovery and Transparency Act and my Meatpacking Special Investigator Act are both critical to lowering costs for producers and consumers.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
My Freedom to Vote Act would've protected same-day registration and set sensible standards for voter ID—like letting students use school IDs.

Access to the ballot box is fundamental. We should be making it easier, not harder, for eligible Montanans to make their voices heard.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Good. These anti-voting laws passed by the Montana Legislature restricted commonsense measures that helped folks access the ballot box.

Things like same-day voter registration—which the people of Montana voted for directly, by the way.
https://t.co/r3A6fV4tgK

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Rural water systems are essential to growing communities and creating jobs in central and eastern Montana, which is why I secured this funding for much-needed infrastructure upgrades.

I’ll keep working to get our targeted investments out the door ASAP.
https://t.co/5G8ggBCiSB

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
If we're going to maintain our competitive edge over China, we've got to strengthen our supply chain and bring jobs back home from overseas.

I'm working with Republicans and Democrats in the House and Senate to work up a final competition and jobs bill that'll do just that.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Honored to be named to the conference committee charged with negotiating the final version of our America COMPETES Act.

I'm looking forward to working across the aisle to craft a final China competition and jobs bill that will strengthen our economy and make us safer.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: Glad to meet with Bozeman Fire Chief Waldo and Columbus Fire Chief Cowger today. With fire season on the horizon, it's critical that Montana's firefighters have the support they need to continue keeping our families and communities safe. https://t.co/mSM8letQhu

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
I stand with the Senate dining workers who are fighting these layoffs, and congratulate them on their success so far. These folks work day in and day out to keep the Capitol running, and we've got to do all we can to make sure their jobs are protected.
https://t.co/auyf99vgA9

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
📬DELIVERED: Our Postal Service Reform Act was just signed into law.

Proud to have worked across the aisle to get this done so Montanans can depend on a reliable and affordable USPS for years to come. It's a great day for Montana and for mail delivery across rural America. https://t.co/Gp05Hquscw

text:
I've always said that the best part of my job is meeting with Montana's next generation of leaders.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
No better way to spend #406Day than talking tourism and the great outdoors!

Patched into a MSU seminar to chat gateway communities with some Bobcats, then met with folks from the US Travel Association who get visitors to Big Sky Country. Our outdoor recreation economy is strong! https://t.co/PnFbmoNkfN

text: Thankful today and every day to call the Last Best Place home. Happy #406Day, Montana! https://t.co/qvzn68Im4o

text: Had a good meeting with the Northwest Public Power Association about rolling out the upgrades secured by my bipartisan infrastructure package. From reducing wildfire risk to expanding high-speed internet, we're working hard to improve our rural way of life. https://t.co/kfmeQR2cWG

text:
Hoppy to see some Montana beer distributors in town with the @NBWA ahead of #NationalBeerDay this week.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
I'm strongly opposed to the Administration's decision to let Title 42 expire next month—which will only add to the strain on our broken immigration system.

I'm urging Sec. Mayorkas to provide a comprehensive plan to address the increased security needed when Title 42 expires. https://t.co/NayQCfBuN5

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
In today's Commerce hearing on the lack of transparency in oil markets, I urged both sides to come together and work to bring down energy costs while addressing our changing climate.

We need to quit pointing fingers and get to work. These costs won't come down on their own. https://t.co/Xv76LecbYE

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:

name: Senator Jon Tester
text: On #GoldStarSpousesDay, let us honor the loved ones of our fallen heroes who gave everything in the line of duty. We are grateful for their service and sacrifice today and everyday. https://t.co/SlDzgpahLo

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
It's no secret that China has been trying to take our position as the world's premier economy—and they've relied on unfair trade practices in the process.

My China Trade Cheating Restitution Act will give our domestic producers what they need to compete.
https://t.co/JJPk3vYOzA

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Students should be focused on learning—not where their next meal is coming from.

That's why I introduced a bill that'll extend @USDA flexibility to ensure Montana kids will keep getting nutritious meals, without burdening local schools with more red tape. Let's get it passed.

name: Senator Jon Tester
text:
Don't want to sound like a broken record, but have I mentioned we're investing in the Milk River Project?

Proud of the $87.5 million in bipartisan infrastructure funds I've secured so far to revitalize the lifeline of the Hi-Line. https://t.co/JqMzSB894V

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text: I have long worked to ensure pro-life protections in the Title X Family Planning Program. The Biden admin’s Title X rule allows federal $ to go to abortion providers. It’s disappointing that @MarcoRubio’s bill I cosponsored to undo this flawed rule failed to pass the Senate.

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text: Sen. Rich Pahls was a colleague  in the Legislature & a good friend. There were many times when I counted on his help as we worked together on important challenges. Rich supported investments in infrastructure & good educational opportunities for our children. He will be missed.

text:
.@SenatorFischer submitts a letter for the record from @NeCattlemen stating that no producers were willing to put themselves "out front" and testify at today's hearing for fear of retribution.

text:

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text: We are also keeping in our prayers the many firefighters, first responders, and national guardsmen who are putting themselves in harms way to continue fighting these fires. (2/2)

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text: Our deepest condolences to the family of retired Cambridge fire chief John Trumble. He lost his life working with firefighting teams to protect Nebraska communities from the severe wildfires devastating our state. (1/2)

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text: Bruce and I are very sad to learn that Senator Orrin Hatch has passed away. He was a wonderful man, a titan of the Senate, and a champion for the people of Utah. Our prayers are with his family.

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text:
Bruce and I are praying for those impacted by wildfires and extreme weather across the western part of our state. First responders are continuing to do heroic work to keep our communities safe.

Be sure to follow guidance from local officials on the latest recommendations.

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text:
Today we celebrate the natural world and the many gifts it gives us. We also renew our commitment to good stewardship of our precious natural resources.

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text:
Brad Ashford was a kind man. He believed in the goodness of his fellow man, in service to others, and in strengthening and growing his community.

name: Senator Deb Fischer
text:
In March, border authorities detained more than 221,000 migrants trying to cross our southern border illegally. 
 
That represents the highest number of arrests in two decades. 
 
Border security is national security. It’s past time to get the #BidenBorderCrisis under control.

text: Sen. Fischer says she’s disappointed this hearing wasn’t delayed so that the commitee had greater time to review the DOD budget with detail.

text: SASC's @SenatorFischer scolds DoD officials over the lack of detailed budget numbers and unclassified strategy docs, which "directly undermines the committee's ability to conduct its oversight work. And it is contrary to the spirit of government public hearings."

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Six million Jews were brutally murdered during the Holocaust by Nazis. It's important #WeRemember these horrifying events so that they never happen again, and remain strong in our fight against anti-Semitism, hatred, and bigotry. #YomHaShoah

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Burning Man will be back in person this August! It was so great to talk with @burningman's leaders about the plans for this year’s festival, its impact on the community, and the ways it will boost Nevada’s economy. https://t.co/zagRXyfpzZ

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Today, I’m voting to protect #TitleX. I will not stand by while Republicans try to take away essential heath care like cancer screenings, reproductive services, STI testing and treatment, and family planning resources. I'll keep working to protect Nevadans' access to health care.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Jason Frierson is a passionate, dedicated, and deeply knowledgeable Nevadan who will make an excellent U.S. Attorney for Nevada. I’m thrilled to celebrate his confirmation, and I look forward to working with him to keep Nevadans safe.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: It takes immense strength for victims of sexual assault to come forward, and #DenimDay calls on us all to condemn victim-blaming and do more to support survivors. I’ve worked to empower survivors my entire career, and I'll keep working to make sure they have the tools to heal.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Since I got to the Senate, I’ve worked to lower health care costs for Nevadans. I’m fighting to lower insulin costs, end egregious price hikes on lifesaving medications, and allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices. I’ll keep fighting for affordable health care for all Nevadans. https://t.co/ihlAwXiz4O

name: Senator Cortez Masto
Senator Cortez Masto
text: Congratulations to the newly named, Las Vegas Desert Dogs! Last year, the @NLL announced Las Vegas will be home to their 15th professional lacrosse team, and I can't wait to see them on the field later this year. https://t.co/leYbXga6Df

name: Senator Cortez Masto

name: Senator Cortez Masto

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: No one should have to ration lifesaving medication. Today I joined patients, @P4ADNOW, and @AARP to talk about the work I’ve been doing to lower prescription drug costs, save Nevadans money at the pharmacy, and keep our seniors healthy. https://t.co/4XDkJMP7Ve

name: Senator Cortez Masto

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: This summer, the Supreme Court will make a decision that will affect women’s reproductive rights across the country. Make no mistake: I have always supported access to the full scope of reproductive health care services, and I always will.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Senator Hatch dedicated his life to working for the people Utah and leaves behind an incredible legacy of public service. My thoughts are with his loved ones during this difficult time.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Today, I join the Armenian community in honoring the 1.5 million victims of the Armenian genocide. We cannot let any nation deny or hide its crimes against humanity, and we must work to make sure they are never repeated.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: During my time in the Senate, I’ve worked to reduce traffic, fix our roads, and help improve travel safety. From upgrades to the I-15/Tropicana interchange to updates to our airports and tourism infrastructure, I’ll keep working for Nevadans. https://t.co/6FypXFbfgb

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Today, @CMSGov proposed a new special enrollment period and late fee waiver for seniors enrolled in Medicaid during the pandemic who are transitioning to Medicare. Thank you @BrooksLaSureCMS for heeding my call to protect the health care of so many Nevada seniors.

name: Senator Cortez Masto

text: Proud to announce @SenMarkKelly and I are introducing a bill to promote economic development in our states by increasing access and funding from @US_EDA. The INVEST in our Communities Act will help diversify Nevada's economy, expand our travel industry, and create more jobs.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Preserving Nevada’s public lands is vital to our work combating climate change. From making our public lands more resilient to wildfires to growing our green energy economy, there is so much we can do to prepare for a sustainable future. https://t.co/RcfDvt99uH

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Nevada is full of vibrant rural communities, and I’m committed to getting them the resources they need to grow and thrive. I’m proud that over $3 million from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that I worked hard to pass is on its way to support rural Nevada. https://t.co/qlErcPlylO

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Today I joined the #NVProviderSummmit to thank healthcare workers for saving so many lives and going above and beyond to take care of us through the pandemic. I’m working to support them and patients by increasing key mental health services.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: I met with Southern Nevada Regional Housing Authority’s Executive Director Lewis Jordan to discuss Nevada’s housing needs. Together, we’re working to bring more affordable housing to Las Vegas and support Nevada’s hardworking families. https://t.co/I16dZW52wr

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: It was great to speak with Nevadans in my hometown about the urgent need to pass legislation to bring down the price of prescription drugs. No one should have to ration lifesaving medication, and I’ll keep working to lower costs for all Nevadans. https://t.co/DcrlFOhI0v

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Paralyzed Veterans Awareness Month gives recognition to the heroes who experienced life-altering injuries while bravely serving our country. These veterans are role models of resilience and strength. I am proud to support our @PVANevada veterans in the Senate. #PVAUnstoppABLE

text: ¡Feliz Pascua a todos en Nevada! Espero que hoy esté lleno de muchas bendiciones.

text: Happy #Easter Sunday to those celebrating across the Silver State. I hope today is filled with many blessings.

text: This week I met with law enforcement in Northern Nevada to discuss funding I secured that will help local police departments support their officers and build out medical and mental resources for Nevadans in need. https://t.co/YK3qbzs48b

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: Black women face greater risk of complications during and after pregnancy than anyone else. I’ve joined legislation with @SenBooker to raise awareness about this during #BlackMaternalHealthWeek, and I’ll keep working to make sure all Nevada parents and children are healthy.

name: Senator Cortez Masto
text: I’ve worked closely with local law enforcement since I was Nevada’s AG and I know that our smaller police departments need more resources. text: I’ve supported Nevada’s law enforcement throughout my career and I’m working hard in the Senate to deliver federal funding to help police officers protect our communities. https://t.co/YfrXr8pWGr
