text: Followed up on my multiple visits to USPS in Charlottesville today to push for accountability for mail delays. Our USPS reform bill should help ease systemic pressures, but I’d also like USPS to have the flexibility to raise carrier pay too. https://t.co/PTfqONIs6C

name: Mark Warner
text: Made my way to Amherst County to survey the situation and talk to local leaders as the James River erodes towards a sewer line. I’ll be following up on this, because further erosion could cause sewage to leak into the James River and then into the Chesapeake. https://t.co/ukGCXBU8Sf

name: Mark Warner
text: Just made a stop in Bedford County to talk about the ways federal dollars are going straight into programs expanding broadband across the Commonwealth. That orange cable behind us is fiber that will soon be deployed to get more of the county internet access! https://t.co/GSrpjPKTgv

name: Mark Warner
text:
Opportunity Scholars is doing incredible work supporting students through high school and helping set them up for college or vocational school. Honored to participate in the dedication for their new building this week. 

https://t.co/2SdZe7MHvR

name: Mark Warner
text:
Really inspiring day in the Valley yesterday, speaking with folks across three counties that are building stronger water infrastructure, working on farmer-focused poultry processing, and making sure all have access to health care.
https://t.co/HsXNGSlhYr

name: Mark Warner
text: Finished up today in Roanoke visiting the Wiley Dr Bridge and talking about how the bipartisan infrastructure law is going to deliver for infrastructure of ALL types – bridges, airports, roads, and more. Also met Dennis and his catch of the day, straight from the Roanoke River! https://t.co/QVZp3UGwxP

name: Mark Warner
text:
Broadband and telehealth aren’t nice-to-haves — they’re need-to-haves. 

Glad to speak with some of our health care heroes in Augusta County today about how we’re leveraging federal and state investments to close the digital divide and expand access to telehealth. https://t.co/gYX2g1y6ER

name: Mark Warner
text:
Warning… politicians in hairnets photos! 

Glad to tour a Farmer Focus processing facility in Harrisonburg today and meet some of the incredible employees that are raising and processing fresh poultry ethically right here in the Valley. https://t.co/lBzbMnzpYF

name: Mark Warner
text: Access to clean, reliable water is fundamental — so I was glad to get a request through Congress to fund a new well and water treatment facility for Frederick Water. Once completed, this project will be self-sustaining and will process water for thousands of Virginians. https://t.co/LIrWe5Chva

name: Mark Warner
text: Today I joined @MarkWarner, @SupervisorLusk, housing officials, and affordable housing developers to discuss access to affordable housing and home ownership. Thanks to @MarkWarner for convening this group in the Braddock District and his creative work to address this key issue. https://t.co/Hccvv5sIUu

name: Mark Warner
text: As the first in my family to graduate college, I’m always thinking about how we can better support students — glad to speak with Opportunity Scholars and the incredible community that supports them in Winchester today. https://t.co/3x9HhWFd8d

name: Mark Warner
text:
Every community needs access to affordable housing. 

Glad to deliver funding to Fairfax County today to create up to 250 affordable housing units and talk to local leaders about how we can further support their initiatives at a federal level. https://t.co/6w9P9q4kWW

name: Mark Warner
text: On the anniversary of the Fair Housing Act, I’m spending the day learning about public-private partnerships preserving affordable housing in Arlington. From supporting projects like this to pushing for laws that support first time homeowners, I’m working to address housing costs. https://t.co/joaKztFin8

name: Mark Warner
text: Happy National Pet Day! Thankful for my dog, the Finnster. I’m still fighting for policies that protect the health of ALL our furry friends across the Commonwealth. https://t.co/Wr5nO2jBwq

name: Mark Warner
text: In case you missed it: the bipartisan infrastructure law is delivered $232 million straight to Virginia to invest in the next generation of public transit. What projects do you want to see in the next decade?

name: Mark Warner
text: On this day in 1945, Buchenwald was liberated. As we remember the atrocities of the Holocaust, it’s important that we also continue to speak out against the vestiges of anti-Semitism that persist to this day.

name: Mark Warner
text: I’m dismayed by the wave of anti-LGBT laws popping up around the country, especially those aimed at students. These kids and families deserve more.

name: Mark Warner
text:
Our China competition bill is a real step we can take towards bringing more manufacturing and research jobs to Virginia. And the whole Virginia delegation is fighting to get them here.
https://t.co/wySeZTq6GC.

name: Mark Warner
text: There’s no doubt that Putin is committing war crimes. Our announcement of the transfer of S-300 missiles yesterday was a positive step towards supporting Ukraine’s military, but more will likely be needed.

name: Mark Warner
text:
This week in the Senate:
👩🏾‍⚖️ Confirmed KBJ
🇷🇺Passed laws reining in Russian trade by a vote of 100-0 
📚Introduced bills to make education more accessible and reform Opportunity Zones
🏫Unanimously passed a law to honor VA's civil rights history

name: Mark Warner
text: Glad to see this delivery. I’ve been calling for extending more military resources to Ukraine, and this is one important step we can take. https://t.co/5ga1i7vT7s

name: Mark Warner
text:
I’m incredibly concerned about the atrocities in Ukraine, and am focused on continuing to get their military all the support we can.
https://t.co/5oH56LbO8V

name: Mark Warner
text: Glad to be on this bipartisan bill – Opportunity Zones can be a powerful tool in supporting underserved communities, but we need to make sure the program has the proper resources and regulations to function well. https://t.co/i1fj0WbDnp

name: Mark Warner
text: I’m proud to call her Justice Jackson. https://t.co/0kLX1Xg8bW

name: Mark Warner
text:
I’m honored to serve on the committee that will negotiate differences and get our China competition bill to @POTUS’ desk as soon as possible.
 
It’s time to boost American manufacturing and ease the supply chain.

name: Mark Warner
text:
Access to lifelong learning and education is a critical tool that workers need. But too many are getting left behind due to the cost.

That’s why I’m sponsoring a bill with @ChrisCoons to create a tax-preferred savings account to make it more affordable to get this education.

name: Mark Warner
text: Justice is served! I voted to confirm Ketanji Brown Jackson as our next Associate Justice of the Supreme Court because she’s qualified, brilliant, and honest. And for the first time in two centuries, the court will contain the voice of a Black woman. https://t.co/qcltHrxvYn

name: Mark Warner
text: BREAKING: Judge Jackson was just confirmed to the Supreme Court. https://t.co/IWgobTmK88

name: Mark Warner
text:
Virginia public transit desperately needs improvements.
 
This morning, I announced an additional $232 million in funding from the infrastructure law to make that happen.

name: Mark Warner
text:
70 years ago, Barbara Johns led a walkout against school segregation in Farmville, VA that spurred a case included in Brown v. Board. 

Yesterday, my bill honoring that history and designating the R.R. Moton School as an affiliated area of the @NatlParkService passed the Senate. https://t.co/9bGYoHPnI8

name: Mark Warner
text: Judge Jackson belongs on the Supreme Court.

name: Mark Warner
text: Proud to have voted yes. USPS is a critical tool for all Virginians, and for too long it hasn’t been able to provide consistent delivery to all. This is a step in the right direction. https://t.co/awAe0wBv0W

name: Mark Warner
text: Gas prices matter – that’s why I’m supporting long and short term solutions like tapping the strategic reserves, investigating price gouging, and moving towards cleaner energy solutions.

name: Mark Warner
text: Earlier today, I held an open Intel hearing as we vet a nominee to be General Counsel of the CIA – our intel community is incredibly talented, and it’s important to me that we continue working to confirm the most qualified folks. https://t.co/KbgQQxZaf5

name: Mark Warner
text: When we passed the omnibus, we secured funding for projects that really matter for Virginia: expanding our ports, strengthening our cyber defenses, getting our servicemembers and their families better housing, and more.

name: Mark Warner
text: I’ve said it once and I’ll say it again: Judge Jackson is qualified, brilliant, and ready to be on the court. https://t.co/cOSueFKaud

name: Mark Warner
text:
If you use Medicare, they now cover up to 8 over-the-counter COVID tests per month! This initiative, combined with @POTUS' plan to get free tests shipped to any household that requests them, will make testing more accessible for all.
https://t.co/kaqtd4shot

name: Mark Warner
text: Abortion access is under attack nationally. It’s time to pass federal protections so state laws like this can’t proceed. https://t.co/xwhl0NoMxn

name: Mark Warner
text: Our bipartisan infrastructure bill is fixing unsound bridges, growing a national electric vehicle charging network, and creating jobs.

name: Mark Warner
text: Judge Jackson is highly qualified, resoundingly endorsed, and brilliant. She belongs on the court. https://t.co/KjiWEtYjlJ

name: Mark Warner
text: We’re closer than ever to getting my bipartisan job creation, inflation-fighting China competition law done and signed into law.

name: Mark Warner
text:
We’re all pushing for action that will protect the animals at the Envigo facility in Cumberland County.
https://t.co/JMVlk8znvs

name: Mark Warner
text: I think about the human cost of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine daily, and I’m continuing to stay focused on how the U.S. can help support Ukrainians.

name: Mark Warner
text: My full statement on my decision to support Judge Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court: https://t.co/RV6FhvEizM

name: Mark Warner
text: It was an honor to meet with Judge Jackson today. I believe she embodies the highest intellect, impartiality, and honesty, and I look forward to casting my vote in support of her nomination. https://t.co/CslkzibkUN

name: Mark Warner
text: When the House passed a copay cap for insulin last week, we got one step closer to making this critical drug affordable to all who rely on it. Let’s finish the job in the Senate and then take further steps toward ending all prescription drug price gouging.

name: Mark Warner
text: I’m extremely pleased to see that @SocialSecurity will be reopening local offices on April 7, including for people without an appointment. SSA should work for everyone, and I’m hoping this makes it easier for Virginians to utilize their services.

name: Mark Warner
text: A key driver of inflation is the out-of-control cost of new and used cars. Our China competition bill directly addresses that by making semiconductors – a key issue in car manufacturing bottlenecks – right here in America. It saves money and it creates good-paying jobs.

name: Mark Warner
text: #Ramadan Mubarak to all those celebrating across Virginia! Best wishes for this holy season.

name: Mark Warner
text: It cannot be said enough – in every stage of Russia’s invasion, the intelligence community has been accurate, timely, and communicative. If we hadn’t had their insight, this invasion likely would have unfolded very differently.

name: Mark Warner
text: Judge Jackson answered what were sometimes bad-faith, cherry-picked attacks on her strong qualifications with complete patience and evenhandedness. She displayed the epitome of a judicial temperament.

name: Mark Warner
text:
Not a bad month for the Senate:
🚺 Reauthorized VAWA
📫 Secured USPS reform
💰 Passed a full spending bill packed w/ VA priorities
👩🏽‍⚖️ Wrapped hearings on a highly-qualified SCOTUS nominee
🇺🇸 Moved forward on China competition bill
 
More progress coming in April!

name: Mark Warner
text: I am so proud to be named @AAPA_Seaports 'Port Person of the Year.' You can bet I will continue to find ways to invest in our ports and our economy! https://t.co/Vf7fo3JEYT

name: Mark Warner
text: On the final day of Women’s History Month, I want to give a special shoutout to my incredible wife, Lisa, and my three daughters! I’m blessed to have a family of strong, thoughtful women.

name: Mark Warner
text:
The horrific continued abuse of dogs and puppies at Envigo's Cumberland County facility is a travesty. It’s time to revoke Envigo’s license. 
https://t.co/rYAVWsJaWf

name: Mark Warner
text: Happy International Transgender Day of Visibility – to all trans people, but especially trans kids: you are seen and valued. I’m proud to support the Equality Act – it’s legislation that would prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: It was great to meet WA state's 2022 Teacher of the Year, Jerad Koepp! Jerad is a member of the Wukchumni tribe and specializes in Native studies at North Thurston Public Schools. His dedication to our students and his community makes such an important difference. #NTOY22 https://t.co/xWAGP68RLl

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: At today's @SenateApprops hearing, I stressed to @SecretaryPete how foundational salmon are to Washington state and asked for an update on the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law programs to address salmon recovery, fish passage, and habitat restoration. https://t.co/YYnkWGpwNV

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Apparently, it wasn’t extreme enough for Oklahoma GOPs to make it a felony to give abortion care—which they already did—now they’re banning abortions after 6 weeks.

Republicans are fighting to rip away our fundamental rights—Democrats are fighting to protect them. https://t.co/wHksIn8mpn

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: We've got to get additional support to Ukraine quickly. The people of Ukraine desperately need military supplies to end this terrible war and humanitarian relief to support those still in Ukraine and the families who have been forced to flee.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: When it comes to our COVID-19 response, we can't shortchange WA state communities. The Senate has got to pass more resources because our communities need tests, treatments, and vaccines to defend our hard-won progress and keep people safe and healthy. https://t.co/WembQswzbJ

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Today while we honor & remember workers who were killed or injured on the job, we’ve got to double down on our commitment to ensure every worker has a safe workplace and working conditions. Workplace health and safety are an essential part of workers’ rights. #WorkersMemorialDay

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: I talked to @WAHospitals & thanked them for their incredible work to keep people in WA state healthy and safe. I’ve fought hard to make sure our hospitals get essential support—& will keep pushing to get them what they need to serve patients. https://t.co/eY9D1dRzyr

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Everyone should have access to the reproductive health care they need—whether that’s birth control, STI testing and treatment, or cancer screenings. MAGA Republicans want to undermine #TitleX and get between you and your doctor. I voted to stop them. #ProtectX

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
This Senate just defeated a Republican effort to undermine the #TitleX program and take away basic health care for birth control, cancer screenings, STI testing and treatment, and much more.

This was an attack on patients—and in particular on women—and we stopped it.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: It was really great to see folks from @CityofWW today and get an update on all their great projects. A big part of my job is making sure our cities have the federal support they need to best serve their community, & I'm glad to be their partner in the other Washington. https://t.co/rzaKI7L2vc

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Millions of people across the country have lost loved family members and cherished friends due to COVID-19. Today I helped honor and remember their lives.

We owe it to everyone who is hurting to learn from this pandemic and act. https://t.co/qHkn7tegIs

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Birth control, cancer screenings, and maternal health care are essential.

Yet tonight, anti-choice Republicans tried reimplementing the #TitleX gag rule, which would deny Granite Staters access to essential services.

I voted no, and I’ll always defend reproductive freedom.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Republicans' forced vote today to reinstate the #TitleX gag rule would make it harder for women—especially those on the tightest budgets—to get birth control and other critical reproductive health care. We've got to #ProtectTitleX. RT if you're with me in this fight.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: The GOP is hell-bent on going after reproductive rights. But that’s not enough. Now, Senate Republicans are trying to undermine the #TitleX family planning program & take away coverage for STI testing & cancer screenings. We can’t let Republicans rip away essential health care.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Once again, Republicans are trying to undermine #TitleX & restrict funding for family planning programs.

Proud to have voted to stop this. 

l will always fight to ensure Nevadans have access to affordable, comprehensive reproductive care.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Right now, Republicans are attempting to undermine the Title X program and tear away access to essential reproductive and sexual health care—I'm voting to stop them. We must protect Title X and make sure patients continue to get the care they need from providers they trust.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Tonight, Republicans are trying to deny patients access to essential and affordable health services through the #TitleX gag rule.

Title X provides patients with access to birth control, cancer screenings, STI testing & treatment. This is an attack on health care.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
#TitleX programs help women and families across the country access contraception, STI testing, and cancer screenings.

Yet tonight, my Republican colleagues are trying to take away these critical protections.

You can bet I'm fighting to stop them.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
I am not going to stand for it.

I didn’t fight tooth and nail to reverse the Trump gag rule and restore millions in funding to help WA state patients just to let Republicans rip that care away again.

I will do everything I can to protect #TitleX—again.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: The message Republicans are sending with this vote—loud and clear—is that they won’t just stop at banning abortion with cruel laws. They are determined to restrict access to all kinds of reproductive health care.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
The #TitleX program helps Washington state patients get:

✅ the birth control they need to plan a family on their own terms,
✅ breast and pelvic exams,
✅ STI testing and treatment,
✅ and so much more.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: LIVE: Republicans are once again forcing a vote to reinstate the #TitleX gag rule and deny women across the country access to birth control & other reproductive health care. I’m on the Senate floor to vote no and lead the charge to fight back. https://t.co/Itjt38P9Ht

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Today, I’m voting to protect #TitleX. I will not stand by while Republicans try to take away essential heath care like cancer screenings, reproductive services, STI testing and treatment, and family planning resources. I'll keep working to protect Nevadans' access to health care.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: We'll boil it down for you: We will not let Republicans turn back the clock on reproductive health – #TitleX is here to stay. https://t.co/lRvTJ3OMHg

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Republicans are once again trying to undermine the #TitleX program, which helps patients access essential health care like:

💊Birth control
🩺STI testing and treatment
🥼Cancer detection screenings

Today, I'm voting to block this attack on our health care and our bodies. https://t.co/boH8EvZswM

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Women will not forget which party is fighting to protect birth control, and which party is doing everything it can to rip your birth control away. #ProtectTitleX

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Here we go again—Republicans are forcing a vote to undermine basic, life-saving health care, like cancer screenings and birth control.

I’m not here for it. I’m going to do everything I can to protect #TitleX. https://t.co/Qa3ENjJSPl

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
The COVID-19 pandemic took a serious toll on the mental health of young people across the country.

Chair @PattyMurray is working on bipartisan legislation to make sure we address this crisis head-on. https://t.co/4y3XV8UiUn

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: The Biden Administration has got to forgive at least some student loan debt for every borrower. RT if you agree.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
The pain the pandemic has caused has been unthinkable.

I’m speaking live with @SenatorMenendez and COVID survivors in remembrance of the people in WA state and across the country that we’ve tragically lost to COVID-19—and to push for change. https://t.co/RKwOITCywz

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: We’ve got to #SolveChildCare and I have a plan to help do it. Fixing the child care crisis is key to building a fairer, stronger economy. https://t.co/v18KD8iz09

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: After working for decades to earn a retirement, people who are offered a lump-sum buyout of their pension deserve better information to make such a critical decision. This bill will make sure they do. https://t.co/B5rjzFyVKX

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: When a parent has to choose between paying rent or paying for the prescription drugs their kids need, that’s an impossible choice—one that no one should have to make. That’s why I’m fighting to lower costs on both so families have the support they need to live and thrive.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Huge thanks to Senator @PattyMurray for taking the time to meet with us to discuss our projects for the upcoming fiscal year. Your support is greatly appreciated! https://t.co/3q9KZpc5CC

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Between new infrastructure projects, emergency services improvements, and so much more, @BenCoWAGov sure has been busy. Thanks for stopping by here in the other Washington to discuss ways I can support all of your great work. https://t.co/4YHWXFfIHI

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: When it comes to fighting diseases—from COVID-19, to measles, and more—getting people vaccinated is essential. We’ve got to do everything we can to protect people using the tools we have—and by developing new ones for emerging threats. #WorldImmunizationWeek

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: It’s illegal for women to have to pay out of pocket for birth control, and I’m making sure we enforce laws that are already on the books to make that a reality. https://t.co/szitXI1haU

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Support for unions is on the rise because they’re good for workers. Period. https://t.co/81zhScxMqJ

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: We passed a historic piece of legislation to bolster our nation's infrastructure—that means better roads, repairing our bridges, newer trains, more transit, and so much more for the people of Washington state.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
This is heartbreaking—and worse, it's a preventable tragedy.

Republicans have got to stop blocking even debate on gun-safety legislation so we can pass common sense laws to help curb gun violence and keep kids and families safe. https://t.co/eXuglIsOS5

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Dollar General & Dollar Tree have to be held accountable for their shameful labor practices. We’ve seen these conditions on social media, in the press, & in lawsuits. I’m demanding answers & changes—we’ve got to hold corporations accountable for how they treat their employees. https://t.co/gpgADrE3mZ

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: I had a great visit at @LifeWireOrg. The work they do to protect and support survivors of domestic violence is so critical to our state. After passing #VAWA, I'll continue fighting to make sure they have the resources they need to keep up their important work. https://t.co/hyk8DfIPZe

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
When @POTUS visited Washington state a few days ago, I told him I’m still pushing hard to pass big, bold climate legislation in the Senate.

It’s what the people of our state want and we owe it to them to build a brighter future for us all.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
The increased Pell Grants I helped pass—the largest in over a decade—are going to help so many Washington state students afford a higher education.

This is just one of many steps we need to take to ensure students can find and afford the education they need to thrive.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: My thoughts are with Harriet Bullitt's family and loved ones today. Harriet was an incredible, iconic woman who devoted her time, resources, and life to protecting the natural beauty of our wonderful state. She will be missed, but her legacy will live on forever. https://t.co/EMtYspBuZf

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
The law is clear: insurance companies are required to pay for your birth control.

But right now, that’s not always the case and it’s making it harder for women to get essential health care—& I’m working to fix that.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Washington state’s restaurants are often the heart of our communities and culture.

I’m working to make sure every one of them can get the relief and support they need.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Washington state cannabis businesses shouldn’t have to fear for their safety because of outdated banking laws. Let’s pass the #SAFEBankingAct and make sure these businesses don’t have to operate fully in cash. https://t.co/CG34XwGtH3

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: I urged @usedgov to fix the income driven repayment system and I’m glad they’re taking steps to do it. We've got to do more to provide relief to student loan borrowers and I’ll keep pushing them on it. https://t.co/w3Y2abldYV

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: On this Earth Day, I signed an Executive Order to strengthen our forests on federal lands and make them more resilient in the face of threats like wildfires. https://t.co/fnbZF2VOou

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Even before this pandemic, child care cost more than college tuition in Washington state. We’ve got to pass my child care plan and help make sure every family can afford it. Anything less is unacceptable.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
I’ve heard from many people from Seattle to Spokane who work hard, play by the rules, & save money, but still have to do things like work an extra job just to afford the life-saving medicine they need.

Democrats are pushing for meaningful steps to lower prescription drug costs.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: When I say I’m going to bat to lower prescription drug costs for Washington state families, that includes fighting back against the corporate greed that has led to skyrocketing drug prices and blocked cheaper generic drugs. It’s unacceptable.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
When families cannot find or afford the child care they need, it’s bad for kids, parents, workers, businesses—everyone.

I'm glad @POTUS is in my corner fighting for child care—we have to fix it and we can.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Helping people and solving problems—that’s our job. We can help working families by passing legislation to put money back in their pockets and take a little stress off their shoulders. I’m laser focused on that.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
I’m with @POTUS in Auburn, WA to talk about why we’ve all got to be fully focused on lowering everyday costs for our state’s working families.

Tune in live below. https://t.co/T8MoZvmQaF

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Today I stood by @POTUS as he signed an executive order to help protect old-growth forests—a straightforward but important strategy in the fight against climate change.

But we need more. I remain focused on sending landmark climate legislation to his desk to protect our earth. https://t.co/QwI0fXjErV

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: There are few more urgent threats to Washington state than climate change. This #EarthDay, know that I am pushing full steam ahead to pass climate legislation that meets the scope of this crisis and protects this beautiful state we call home.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Today, @POTUS is here in Washington state.

I look forward to talking to him about the things people in our state care most about—including lowering costs on necessities like child care and prescription drugs, and taking big, bold action to address the climate crisis.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
I have a bold child care plan that’s going to make a real difference for Washington state families.

And today I visited a @YMCASeattle child care center to make clear that I’m going to do everything I can to get it passed. https://t.co/Rmg2ZGfVoL

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Our child care system is broken, and Washington state families—and child care providers—deserve better.

My fully paid for child care plan will cut families’ costs, increase options, and raise wages for child care workers.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
There's a lot I'm working on to help lower Washington state families' costs on:

🚸 child care
💊 prescription drugs
🏠 housing
➕ and so much more

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
We need a student loan payment pause extension until at least 2023. There’s more the Biden Administration has got to do in the meantime—like forgiving some debt for all borrowers and fixing the broken student loan system.

Chair @PattyMurray is going to keep pushing on this.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: @WANationalGuard Thanks for showing me around and for your service. What you all do is so important to our communities and state—and I’ll always do whatever I can to support our National Guard members in the other Washington.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Sen. @PattyMurray visited Camp Murray yesterday to meet @WANationalGuard leaders after securing funds for the construction of a new Air Support Operations Group Complex. The complex brings together 3 units in order to leverage training resources so they can train like they fight. https://t.co/Cz4GTlP8Vp

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Just this year, too many extreme abortion restrictions have already been enacted on the state-level.

Make no mistake: the extreme GOP are coming after the right to abortion. We’ve got to protect that right and make sure everyone can get the health care they need.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: It was great to meet with servicemembers & tour Camp Murray today to learn more about how they're using the federal funding I secured for their facilities here in Tacoma. Our national guard is always among the first to protect the people of our state—& we’ve got to support them. https://t.co/LnuGqX7EiW

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Great to be in Spanaway today for the groundbreaking of @BethelSD’s new family support center. This is such an important project that will help so many kids & families get the care they need, & I’m glad I was able to secure the federal funds to help make this a reality. https://t.co/GjzDxXD49w

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Today I joined @WATreasurer & local cannabis store owners in Tukwila to talk about the #SAFEBankingAct.

Right now, law-abiding cannabis stores are wrongly forced to only accept cash, & that’s dangerous. I know there’s bipartisan support to pass this & I’m working to get it done. https://t.co/FYp5MC8f64

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Federal laws on cannabis haven’t caught up with Washington state & it’s hurting small businesses and putting workers in danger. We’ve got to pass the #SAFEBankingAct because it makes absolutely no sense that legal cannabis businesses are being forced to operate entirely in cash.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Washington state nurses have been stretched thin and pushed to the brink over the course of this pandemic. Our entire health care workforce needs more support and resources—and I’m working on delivering just that. https://t.co/p7glXL5ca7

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Under Chair @PattyMurray’s child care plan, the vast majority of working families will pay no more than 7% of their income on child care—with a lot of families paying less or nothing at all.

That’s thousands of dollars in savings a year.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Abortion bans don't just hurt women trying to get an abortion—they undermine our health care system and can make it harder for patients everywhere to get the health care they need. https://t.co/Gxp4Izqw0w

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Really excited I got to join @MyCommTrans in Lynnwood for the groundbreaking of the Swift Orange Line project. This line is going to connect more people in south Snohomish County to @soundtransit, and I’m so glad we got the federal support needed to make it a reality. https://t.co/fg1IRJmP4E

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: The income-driven repayment system should make sure student loan borrowers’ payments don’t break the bank & provide a reliable path to debt relief. For too long, that wasn’t the case. I pushed @usedgov to fix these longstanding failures & I’m glad they’re taking steps to do so. https://t.co/ddVjwD3oe0

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
A recent investigation found the income-driven repayment system is failing student loan borrowers.

WA state borrowers deserve better. I’m urging @usedgov to finally reform this system, fix the harm already done, & extend the payment pause until at least 2023 to do it. https://t.co/Xm3GC9lsty

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Washington state's national parks and scenic landscapes are a staple of our state, communities, and way of life. I'm so grateful to call this beautiful place home—and will do everything I can to protect WA's parks for generations to come. 📸 @NCascadesNPS #NationalParkWeek https://t.co/j2UXHa7hDS

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Abortion bans don’t stop at state lines—restricting abortion anywhere hurts patients everywhere. https://t.co/rFjfF9rPcy

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
As the daughter of a WWII veteran, I know the sacrifices our servicemembers & their families make for our country.

I’m working to make sure kids of our servicemembers have the support they need—whether it’s a good education or a roof over their heads.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: Amidst rising costs and an ongoing pandemic, we need immediate relief for student loan borrowers. We’ve got to forgive some student loan debt for every single borrower.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: RT if you support big, bold action to help address the climate crisis.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: When it comes to child care, we need bold solutions—not inadequate tweaks to a broken system that’s leaving so many families behind. That’s what I'm proposing: a fully paid for plan to lower child care costs, get families more options, & boost wages for child care workers.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Birth control. Life-saving breast and pelvic exams to detect cancer early. STD testing and treatment.

The #TitleX program helps patients get these and so much more. It's unthinkable that Republicans would try to take that away. https://t.co/jor8lvOq21

name: Senator Patty Murray
text:
Americans haven’t given up on protecting the right to vote—and I haven’t either.

I’m still fighting to make sure we expand vote by mail, make Election Day a holiday, and make it easier for every eligible citizen to exercise their right to vote.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: There’s a lot more we’ve got to do to protect our country—and the world—from the next public health crisis. I’ve got bipartisan legislation in the works to help make sure we’re better prepared for whatever comes next.

name: Senator Patty Murray
text: People in WA state are feeling the effects of rising costs, whether it’s at the grocery store or gas station. I’m working with Democrats to address rising costs for our families in every possible way—like lowering the cost of prescription drugs & strengthening our supply chains.

name: Senator Patty Murray

text:
Ask anyone who’s looked for housing anywhere in our state recently: whether it’s rent or a mortgage, housing just costs too much.

From Puget Sound to Spokane, you should be able to afford a roof over your head.

text: Introduced the ENSURE Act w/ @SteveDaines & @RogerMarshallMD to protect the availability of American energy & guard against even higher energy prices for American families. https://t.co/FO51kHUHbE

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: Democrats are blaming high gas prices & inflation on everything but themselves. COVID, the economy, the supply chain, corporations, Putin. Blame, blame, blame, but they won't look in the mirror. Democrats know they have a very serious problem when it comes to American families. https://t.co/H9fnyJCO2j

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: .@SenJohnBarrasso on gas tax holiday: "Just a Band-Aid on a bullet hole. They put the bullet hole into the energy industry, and now they want to put a little Band-Aid over it by lowering it, but only until after the election, then if they get reelected, going right back up." https://t.co/K31ClcsPc2

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: .@POTUS' policies against American energy have resulted in much higher energy prices for American families. Half of Wyoming is federal land and it’s sitting on a treasure trove of American energy. We have it all. But Joe Biden wants to keep Wyoming energy in the ground. https://t.co/YQWeycINdn

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: Maybe we ought to have @POTUS tell the Energy Committee why it is that he has Venezuela and Iran on speed dial, but continues to tie up American energy producers in red tape. Clearly, Joe Biden has earned the title of the president of high gas prices. https://t.co/p6b7Uxjshg

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text:
I agree @SenJohnBarrasso! The U.S. should always look to eliminate our dependence on Russia. 

We must utilize our abundant natural resources from uranium, to coal, and oil and gas. Doing so would strengthen our national security and protect the environment. https://t.co/59WUYYcKMw

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: #ICYMI: Wrote in @CSTribune on how we must end American dependence on Russian uranium. The nuclear fuel supply chain should begin with American uranium & end with American fuel. https://t.co/yhHVADQGbu

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: .@POTUS needs to tell NATO we collectively will supply Ukraine weapons they know how to use. Two, he needs to go from Brussels to the eastern front of NATO to show the resolve of NATO & USA. Third, he needs to commit to producing more American energy & sending it to our allies. https://t.co/8NbipF3yGe

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: There's a bipartisan group in Washington committed to helping the heroic people of Ukraine. We are trying to get the Biden administration onboard to a level that we feel we've filled the void in a bipartisan way. @POTUS has had to be pushed and pulled to where he is today. https://t.co/ScrWUhrHiZ

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: .@POTUS can't hide from the fact that he is the president of high gas prices. Democrats are looking for anyone to blame, whether it's Putin, Republicans, energy companies, or Covid. text: The whole #SCOTUS nomination process will be fair and respectful. I met with Judge Jackson this week and we discussed judicial philosophy. She is clearly very intelligent. text: In 1894, Estelle Reel was the 1st woman elected to statewide office in WY as Superintendent of Public Instruction. In 1898, she became the U.S. Superintendent of Indian Schools, making her the 1st woman confirmed to a federal office by unanimous vote in the US Senate. https://t.co/LxxS58S4Na

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text:
It is clear that gas prices have risen due to the current administration’s zealous agenda to reduce domestic oil and gas production.

But Democrats have proposed that market manipulation or some other type of collusion among members of the oil and gas industry is the real cause.

name: Sen. John Barrasso
text: Banning Russian uranium imports will further defund Russia’s war machine, help revive American uranium production, and increase our national security. https://t.co/U7lwt39Fg1

text: Introduced legislation with @SenLummis, @RogerMarshallMD, & @SenKevinCramer to ban imports of Russian uranium. We know Vladimir Putin uses this money to help fund his brutal and unprovoked war in Ukraine.
